Itching on her hands and her feet; Chills; Clammy; Sensitivity to light; inflammation; Under her eyes it is swollen; She was having severe diarrhea; having severe dry heaves; vomiting bile; It had dehydrated her/lead to dehydration; Her throat closing up and it being sore from vomiting and dry heaving; couldn't swallow to get any fluids in; Her throat closing up and it being sore from vomiting and dry heaving; she was struggling with having a dry mouth; puffiness; Headache; severe muscles aches/Muscles pain; feeling nauseous; Was a little warm on her arms/ it was warm to the touch; it just looked like a bee sting and it wasn't super sore; sensitive to the touch; It had big red spots; had a little tiredness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 60-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 16Apr2021 at 10:00 (at age of 60 years old, Lot Number: EW0ISO) as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included she had lupus, sjogren's syndrome. The patient's concomitant medications not reported. The patient previously took Pneumonia Vaccine on 04Mar2021 (Anatomical Location: Left arm); took the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 26Mar2021 at 10:00 (at age of 60 years old, Lot Number: the lot number starts with ER something and then it ends with a 3) as single dose for covid-19 immunization; took azathioprine for lupus and had allergic reaction; took belimumab (BENLYSTA), subcutaneous from an unspecified date (Lot Number: PV7G; Expiration Date: Jun2023, NDC: 49401-088-01, Number on the side: 0147098) to an unspecified date, self injection once a week for lupus. She gets it through the VA and it is subcutaneous use and the manufacturer is company. she was immunocompromise, she had lupus, so she was off of her medication (BENLYSTA) for a month per the CDC guidelines. She wanted to let Pfizer know that as well. For her first COVID vaccine she was originally scheduled to go 6 to 7 days after she had her pneumonia shot and they told her that she would have to wait 2 weeks before having her COVID shot and she did. Other than that she had followed the guidelines and she had been able to take her regular medications but she had to stop her Benlysta because of her immune system and everything. She had been following through on what the CDC has said. Patient stated that she just did a follow up with her doctor because of what happened after her second Pfizer COVID vaccine and her doctor recommended her to let Pfizer know about the side effects that she was having. On Friday 16Apr2021 she had her shot at 10 AM and it was no big deal, it was a little warm on her arms. She stated that it just looked like a bee sting and it wasn't super sore, it was warm to the touch and sensitive to the touch. It had big red spots and there has really been no change since it began. It looks about the size of a bee sting and it was still there. She had a little tiredness and she was not hungry but when she woke up at 06:40 the next morning (17Apr2021) on Saturday she was having severe dry heaves and vomiting bile and she could not get it under control. It had dehydrated her and she was having severe muscles aches. She had the severe dry heaves and the vomiting that lead to dehydration and then she went to the emergency room and she got replenished and they had given her something for feeling nauseous and eventually she was released 3 to 4 hours later. They gave her pills as well so she was doing well now and she hasn't done anything since she went to the emergency room with the vomiting and feeling nauseous. She went there about 1030 to 1040. Before she went she couldn't stop and she told herself that if it didn't stop on the 5th time then she was going to go to the emergency room and it got really bad so she had to call 911 to come and get her. Then she was having severe diarrhea on Sunday (18Apr2021) and the only way she could stop that was for her husband to pick up antidiarrheal pills. That only went away because of the medicine from the pharmacy. She had the over the counter medicine and she took Imodium. She hasn't been eating a lot so she hasn't had a bowel movement since she took that medication. When she had diarrhea there was no substance, it was very watery. And now today (unspecified date) she was having another reaction that she was seeing and it was just itching on her hands and her feet. She had been continuing to take the Benadryl and something that they gave her in the emergency room and she had taken Tylenol for the little headache that she has had. She had a slight headache and she was still taking Tylenol like they had recommended. This began the same time as she was vomiting on 17Apr2021 when she was going through all of that she had the slight headache. But her biggest concern was during this time when initially on Saturday (17Apr2021), her throat closing up and it being sore from vomiting and dry heaving, she was having the dry heaves her airway closed shut and she couldn't swallow to get any fluids in. Her concern was that the back of her throat was killing her and it was totally closed up so she had to go to the emergency room. She had recognized this because in the past she has had a medication where she had an allergic reaction (she thinks it is the medication that they gave her for lupus because she has been on several different things. She thinks azathioprine but she can't recall exactly but she thinks that might of been the one that did it to her) and it had closed her esophagus up the same way like this. This time it got worse to where she couldn't even swallow water no less a pill. This was on 17Apr2021. When she went to the emergency room they gave her the hydrocortisone to take it down and she actually had felt better while she was waiting for the saline drop. She was able to swallow when her airway was opened again by the time they treated it with the hydrocortisone. Around 16:00 she was better when she left the emergency room that same day 17Apr2021. She doesn't really have a sore throat, it is pretty fine. It seems to be okay she thinks that once the dry heaves and all that stopped it helped to relax that. She was a little raspy from the whole thing and she was struggling with having a dry mouth but that even had been resolved as far as her throat. She had no other reactions than what she explain but she also had a lot of muscles pain but that was to be excepted because it says that on all that she has read. She had had all of the reactions listed except for fever. She had had chills and then when clammy and then was clammy and had chills. She had all of those side effects listed on the sheet and when she went on Saturday following her vaccine to the emergency room most of the side effects were treated in emergency room. They gave her Pepcid, hydrocortisone through her IV and gave her Zofran for the vomiting and they said to keep taking acetaminophen. They gave her cetirizine for allergy or the itching or whatever and they also gave her famotidine which she thinks is Pepcid. Since being off the lupus drug she was getting her symptoms again such as sensitivity to light, inflammation and the dry heaves didn't help so under her eyes it was swollen and she just takes it as it was because she was not on her medication and she had something else injected inside of her. Also, she had Sjogren's disease too so her eyes were already drier than normal and she had had puffiness since 17Apr2021 when she was vomiting. She just wanted to make sure that Pfizer got that information because she didn t see that listed. The only side effect she was related was the swollen glands and she has glands in her throat but she wanted to be sure that Pfizer had that data just in case if it could help someone else. Again, she wants to reiterate that with her first dosage she had no problems. She couldn t even see the mark and all of this is stemming from the second dose of the COVID vaccine. The outcome of the events "Dry heaves, Bilious vomiting, Dehydration, Her throat closing up and it being sore from vomiting and dry heaving, Unable to swallow, Dry mouth, Nauseous" was recovered on 17Apr2021. The outcome of events "Feeling of warmth, Vaccination site pain, Hyperaesthesia, Vaccination site erythema, Tiredness" not recovered. The outcome of the event "Headache" was recovering. The outcome of other events was unknown. No follow up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

body aches; Headache; sleepiness; Fatigue; Chills; body temperature: 97.5-98.7; Ear pain; sense of fullness in ears and lymph nodes; sense of fullness in ears and lymph nodes; I feel pretty awful after this first dose.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse reporting for herself. A 60-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 03Feb2021 17:40 (Batch/Lot Number: EL9269) as single dose at the age of 60-year-old for COVID-19 immunisation, offered at the health system she works for and administered at hospital. Medical history included ongoing acoustic neuroma on 8th cranial nerve left side, on the side she felt the intense ear pain, diagnosed 2007-2008, thyroid cancer from 2004 and thyroid removed, her hormone levels are normal, COVID-19 in Dec2020. No history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. No additional vaccines administered on same date of BNT162B2. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). There were no concomitant medications. The patient experienced I feel pretty awful in Feb2021 with outcome of unknown, ear pain on 03Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered, sense of fullness in ears and lymph nodes on 03Feb2021 with outcome of recovered on 05Feb2021, body aches on 04Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered, headache on 04Feb2021 with outcome of recovering, sleepiness on 04Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered, fatigue on 04Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered, chills on 04Feb2021 with outcome of not recovered, body temperature: 97.5-98.7 on 04Feb2021 with outcome of unknown. The events did not require a visit to Emergency Room or Physician Office. The course of events was as follows: Patient expected that since she just had COVID in Dec2020, she thought her response to the vaccine would not be severe because she already had some immunity from the infection. The evening of the vaccine, on 03Feb2021, she experienced ear pain and a sense of fullness in her ears and lymph nodes. The ear pain was almost immediate after vaccination. On 04Feb2021, the next day, she woke up with a headache. It was an unusual headache. It did not go away with Tylenol. Then about halfway through the day, she developed significant body aches like when she had COVID. She also experienced extreme sleepiness like when she had COVID too. She took Motrin and had to lie down during her work day. The Motrin did help. Then mid morning 04Feb2021, she got a chill. She couldn't get warm enough. She had no fever. She checked multiple times. Her temps ranged from 97.5-98.7 on 04Feb2021. She experienced fatigue. She did not know the seriousness for any of the side effects she experienced. As of 05Feb2021, her headache has improved. She was still experiencing sleepiness and fatigue. The chills she developed mid day. She had not them right now. She has better and worse moments just like when she had COVID. She was worried about the second one. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 97.5-98.7 on 04Feb2021, COVID-19: positive in Dec2020. No other relevant tests. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of headache and sleepiness. A Product Complaint was filed.
60 2021-05-16 anaphylactic reaction Anaphylaxis (lip swelling, generalized hives, shortness of breath) within 30-45 minutes of vaccine.... Read more
Close
Anaphylaxis (lip swelling, generalized hives, shortness of breath) within 30-45 minutes of vaccine. Because patient has a history of anaphylaxis, she was able to treat it by giving herself epinephrine, oral antihistamines, and nebulizer treatment with levalbuterol every few hours for the next 3 days. She recovered and did not report this until 5/12/21.

Rash on face; Rash on neck; swollen tongue; swollen lips; swollen face; itchy hands/Itchy; Lip tingling; Swelling of the arms; swelling and tingling; swelling and tingling; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer sponsored program support. A contactable consumer (patient) reported that a 60-year-old non pregnant female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6206, Expiry Date of Covid-19 Vaccine: Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 05Mar2021 03:00 PM in the left arm at 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient age at vaccination was 60 Years. Medical history included vertigo, migraines, Sjogren's syndrome (diagnosed about 10 year ago), thyroid cancer, diabetes and high blood pressure. known allergies included Latex, daptomycin, ceftaroline fosamil, doxcycline, fremanezumab-vfrm. The patient had second shingles shot with Shingrex and she got a few chicken pox rash around the shot itself but that's pretty normal, the onset age was 58 years and at the age of 60 years old at the time of the last flu vaccine, and has received multiple flu shots in the past with unknown brand of flu vaccine. On 05Mar2021 03:15 PM, the patient experienced rash on face, rash on neck, swollen tongue, swollen lips, swollen face, itchy hands/Itchy, lip tingling, swelling of the arms and swelling and tingling. The report received as, on 05Mar2021, received her first Pfizer Covid vaccine dose. 10 minutes later patient had an allergic reaction which included swelling of her lips and tongue, rash on her body, and swollen and itchy hands. The patient reported a second reaction on 07Mar2021, which were the same symptoms as the first and then another (3rd) reaction on 12Mar2021. She has been to the ER 3 times and was prescribed oral steroids and was given a steroid injection each time. She feels that each time the steroid injection wears off, the symptoms return. She wants to know how long this side effect could last. The patient had allergic reactions to it and patient as now had three allergic reactions to it and was wondering have you had other people that have had multiple allergic reactions if the steroid they were given has run out. The patient was given Decadron on day 1 and it ran out in a couple of days because it's a short-acting steroid, then they gave her the longer-acting five-day steroid, betamethasone, patient was taking oral, but it's not as good as the beta methasone shot, patient was asking to have we had other people who have needed more steroids even though the shots have stayed in their system. She wants to know if she is going to have more allergic reactions down the road as the steroids' run out. The patient had three injectable rounds of steroid shots on 05Mar2021, 07Mar2021, and 12Mar2021 and had two courses of oral steroids on 05Mar2021 and 12Mar2021. The patient said 10 to 15 minutes after receiving the shot, had lip swelling and tingling, rash on face, then within a half hour started to swell up. The patient stated that at the center where she got her vaccination, they gave her Benadryl but noticed her symptoms getting worse, packed her up in an ambulance to hospital, and there they gave her Decadron and Pepcid and more Benadryl. The patient states it wasn't anaphylaxis but was an allergic reaction. This was on 05Mar2021, right after getting the shot. It is explained the events improved when given the medications at the ER. She still gets a little itchy once in a while but she is on oral steriods and 50 mg of Benadryl every day. This is her third injectable and second round or oral steriods. Caller has not NDC, Lot, or Expiry for those product as they are from the pharmacy. She also has no NDC, Lot, or Expiry for the Benadryl being used, it is also from the pharmacy. The patient informed as, this was her first Covid vaccination and she was not getting the second one. The patient husband and daughter have had their Covid vaccines and had no reactions at all. The patient was not had covid prior and post vaccination. The patient was not received other vaccine in four weeks. Abd received many daily prescriptions and supplements medications in two weeks. Adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events and treated with Benedryl, Steroids, Pepcid. Outcome of the events itchy hands/Itchy, swelling of the arms, swelling and tingling was unknown, for remaining events outcome was recovering. Follow-up attempts are required. Further information was expected.

A 60-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 20May2021 11:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0165) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation (age at vaccination was of 60 years). Medical history included rheuatoid arthritis, surgical asplenia. Patient also allergic to Pineapple. No other vaccine was recieved by the patient in four weeks. The patient received other concomitant medications in two weeks. Historical vaccine included bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 30Apr2021 14:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0169) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation (age at vaccination was of 60 years). On 21May2021 12:15, the patient experienced short of breath, increasing difficulty breathing, anaphylaxis, in order hoarseness, voice sounds like laryngitis, in order hoarseness, voice sounds like laryngitis, lips tingling, eyes swelling, wheezing, dizziness. Patient took 50mg Benadryl at 12:30 with no relief and went to ER. The ER (emergency room) diagnosed anaphylaxis and started treatment at 13:37. EpiPen, famotidine (Pepsid), SoluMedrol PF was given as treatment. Patient recovered with lasting effects. No covid prior vaccination was reported. Patient was not tested for covid post vaccination. Outcome of all events was recovered with sequelae. Follow up attempts are needed. Further information has been requested.

A 60-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6201), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Right on 11Feb2021 at 10:30 (at the age of 60 years old) as 1st dose, single for COVID-19 immunization. Concomitant medications included atorvastatin calcium (ATORVASTATIN CALCIUM); metoprolol tartrate (METOPROLOL TARTRATE); omeprazole (OMEPRAZOLE); levothyroxine sodium (LEVOTHYROXINE SODIUM) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The symptoms are beginning to subside now but was scheduled to get her 2nd dose on March 4th. She would like some guidance. The patient was treated with antibiotics. Close
The first day when I woke up I had really bad back pain and I was really sleepy. towards the afternoon I became very itchy. The itching and hives would become increasingly worse. I didn't take it for anything. On Saturday I went to work still itching I called the nurse at work on the hotline and explained what was happening. I was told to take Benadryl but could not because it would make me drowsy. I finished work and took the Benadryl after. I also started to break out into hives, the itching was turning into hives. On Sunday I got up for work and the hives were large and like welts. This was all over my body. The itching was still present as well. I was advised to go to an urgent care or a doctor. On Monday morning I woke up and everything was swollen: my face, my lips. I went to the Dr's office where they gave me steroids and an epi pen as well as oral steroids. After the steroids, the swelling went down after a few days. The itching had also ceased. The itching lasted from Friday up until Monday when I got the steroid shot on Thursday.

Stated that she has had no heart palpitations since 5am this morning (24May2021). Stated that her fever is 99.9 Caller keeps rambling on; unable to clarify details with each event. Stated that the migraine is now a headache. She wants to know what would happen if she doesn't get the second dose of the vaccine. The patient received no treatment. Close
2nd dose: Stinging a few minutes after shot, I felt really woozy, and then started shaking all over having a hard time processing and talking. Went home the next day (Wed) fever, chills, headache, 24 hours better, returned to work on Thursday, day (2). Day (3), Friday, I noticed a red rash at the site of the injection earlier in the day, but no symptoms, just a little tender. Friday evening I noticed a little SOB, a little burning sensation under my skin on both forearms, and a couple times felt a little dizzy, but I didn't think much about it. Day (4) Saturday morning, I went to spin class, I felt a little off, halfway through spin class I noticed I was struggling with some breathing, thought it was because I was wearing mask, but pushed through. Ran a couple of errands afterwards and then noticed the SOB was continuing, my skin started burning again under forearms and now my legs with tingling into my feet. At this point I decided I probably needed to go home. On my way home my chest started to hurt in the very center of my chest, and slowly felt like some pressure, with squeezing sensation. Then starting at the center of my chest I could almost feel what felt like a numbness creepy from my chest to my throat. I went to the ER. My legs felt really wobbly and had a difficult time walking, and was feeling dizzy. They ran a variety of blood work and tests. They noted my D-dimers were elevated and (4) lymph nodes enlarged. They ran an additional series of test and released me at 10pm with follow-up to cardiologist. I am still experiencing SOB, not as bad, and the burning sensations under my skin.

A 60-year-old female patient received BNT162b2 (PFIZER BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Lot number- EW0162) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 23Mar2021 between 17:20-17:30 as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing rheumatoid arthritis (from 2003), she has had rheumatoid arthritis for almost 20 years. Concomitant medication included Xeljanz XR 11mg. On 24Mar2021, patient had fever of 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit, chills, headache, she was tired. On an unspecified date in Mar2021, her hands and feet got real swollen, she had not felt right since she had COVID-19 Vaccine. It was reported that patient received her second shot of Pfizer (COVID-19) Vaccine on 13Apr2021 and experienced really bad flare up of rheumatoid arthritis in Apr2021. The patient stated she got both doses of the Pfizer (COVID-19) Vaccine, and after her second (COVID-19) Vaccine, she had a really bad flare up of rheumatoid arthritis. The patient stated her doctor put her on Prednisone for 2 weeks. Reported she had received her second COVID-19 Vaccine dose right before her 61st birthday. She said she went to her rheumatologist, and her rheumatologist told her she should report her side effects to Pfizer. She said she already reported her COVID-19 Vaccine side effects on V-Safe. Patient took 1 Tylenol (8HR Arthritis Pain Extended Release 650mg, Lot Number: LPA095, Expiration Date: Aug2020) for a fever of 101.5 degrees Fahrenheit. She said the Tylenol helped her fever, providing. Reported the Tylenol 8HR Arthritis Pain Extended Release 650mg was expired, but the product still worked. Patient stated for Rheumatoid Arthritis Flare Up, her rheumatologist prescribed 1 Prednisone 5mg tablet, once a day, for 2 weeks. She said she saw her rheumatologist on 17May2021. She said she completed her Prednisone 5mg prescription, and the Prednisone 5mg tablets were dispensed in a pharmacy bottle, and she didn't have the Prednisone 5mg NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. Reported she was feeling better now, but wanted to report her Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine side effects to Pfizer, so she could help other people with rheumatoid arthritis. Reported she continued to take her Xeljanz XR 11mg while she took the Prednisone 5mg tablets, providing the Xeljanz XR 11mg (NDC Number: 0069-0501-30, LOT Number: DJ2906, Expiration Date: 31May2022). Reported she was feeling better now, but she was not 100%. She said she could actually walk now. She said she still had swelling in her hands and feet. She said the swelling had improved in her hands, saying she could make a fist now, but she couldn't wear her wedding ring. She her sandals still felt tight on her feet. Reported she was very reluctant to get a COVID-19 Vaccine booster shot in 12 months with her auto immune disease. She said she was not going to get the COVID-19 Vaccine booster, if she was going to have the same reaction she had after her second COVID-19 Vaccine dose. Patient asked if Pfizer had done any studies with people who had rheumatoid arthritis and the COVID-19 Vaccine. The outcome of the event fever, chills, headache was recovered on 25Mar2021 and outcome of the other events was recovering. Follow up attempts are needed. Further information has been requested.

Close
Small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection; Small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 61-years-old female patient (not pregnant) received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EH9899), intramuscularly on 21Dec2020 12:30 to at single dose on left arm for COVID-19 immunization in hospital. Medical history included crohn's disease. No known allergies. Concomitant medications within 2 weeks of vaccination included estradiol, progesterone, colestipol hydrochloride (COLESTID), ustekinumab (STELARA), cyanocobalamin (B12). The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced small bowel obstruction with diffuse bowel and pelvic lymphadenopathy 36 hours after injection on 22Dec2020 22:00 with outcome of recovered in Dec2020. The adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care, hospitalization for 3 days. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of event included inpatient observation, nothing by mouth (reported as NPO), intravenous fluids. No COVID prior vaccination, COVID test nasal swab was negative on 23Dec2020 post vaccination. It was not reported as serious.; Sender's Comments: There is not a reasonable possibility that reported events small bowel obstruction and lymphadenopathy are related to BNT162B2 vaccine. The patient had underlying Crohn's disease, which put patient at risk of developing the event. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Immediately after receiving the vaccine, patient developed sensation of throat numbness in the back of the throat. Patient denied SOB, wheezing, throat swelling, stridor, rash, chest pain, tongue swelling. One dose of diphenhydramine 25 mg PO suspension and referred to the Mount Sinai emergency department. Sensation resolved after a total of 30 minutes (10 minutes after receiving diphenhydramine). Vital signs and physical exam were WNL with the exception bilateral submandibular adenopathy. Patient was observed in the ED for approximately one hour with no clinical change and was subsequently discharged home.

She has had pain in her whole arm on an unspecified date. On 03Jan2020, her face also started to feel funny. She clarifies by "feeling funny", she meant she started to experience numbness in her right cheek, only her cheek, like when one gets a vaccination when they go to a doctor's office/dentist office and it starts working and one can feel it getting numb. She verifies the numbness in both her cheek and arm started occurring on 03Jan2020 around 7-8pm. She is fine today and then she'll start to feel the numbness again in her cheek and arm. She clarifies the numbness comes and goes. It comes in the morning and then goes away and then the numbness starts again. She started to feel numb in her face and cheek, like when one gets a Novocain at the dentist office and it starts working- it's like the same feeling. 61 2021-01-11 peripheral swelling fever; nausea; general feeling of unwell; soreness at site; redness; whole upper arm was swollen aft... Read more
Close
fever; nausea; general feeling of unwell; soreness at site; redness; whole upper arm was swollen after the injection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other HCP (patient, Respiratory Therapist) reported that a 61-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE , Batch/lot number: EJ1685) via an unspecified route of administration on 21Dec2020 around 6:00 PM in left upper arm at 0.3mL single dose for COVID Prevention. The patient's medical history was covid at the end of Apr/May2020 with shortness of breath, seasonal allergies and allergies to "some anitbiotics." The concomitant medications was reported as none, received no other vaccines on the same day as the COVID vaccine. The patient experienced soreness at site, redness and swelling, fever, nausea, general feeling of unwell 3 days. Patient stated, "I had covid at the end of April/May with shortness of breath. I thought I would have less reaction from the vaccine. I know someone who was out of work for a while week after the vaccine." States that she read that the 2nd dose is supposed to have worse side effects than the first. If she had bad side effects from the 1st dose, will the 2nd be worse? Also asking if the side effects are the immune system reacting or just an allergic reaction. Patient was anxious about getting her second COVID shot on 11Jan2021. Patient stated that she had all the side effects listed, for three days. Patient stated that she didn't mind the side effects at the time, she had fever, soreness at the injection site, nausea, and a general feeling of unwell, but Patient stated that she could not work like that. Patient stated that her question was, statistically she has read that the side effects from the second shot are supposed to be worse than the first shot, but she was wondering, if she had bad side effects from the first shot, will her side effects be worse after the second, or will they maybe be lessened because she already had bad side effects. Patient reported that she did fill out the VSafe significant because she had to work on the third day after her shot, which was Christmas Eve, and work, was so busy and she did not feel well. Patient stated that she does have two days scheduled off work after her next injection, but it is the third day that she was worried about because she does not want to work feeling like that. Patient stated that the arm soreness started that same day (21Dec2020). At first, Patient reported that the arm soreness resolved, but then she states that it is still a little sore to the touch. So Patient confirmed that it is ongoing but improved. Patient reportsed that the fever started the day after the injection, 22Dec2020 and it has resolved. Patient reported that the last day she recorded a fever was on 24Dec2020. Patient stated that she woke up on 24Dec2020 and her temperature was normal, so she went to work and she did not feel so well at work, but they were so busy that she barely noticed, and then when the Patient went home that night, she took her temperature and it was 100 degrees Fahrenheit. Patient reported that the nausea started on 22Dec2020, which was mild at times, but then she got to where she did not want to eat. Patient reported that the nausea has resolved but she was not entirely sure when it resolved because she had been so busy at work on 24Dec2020, and it was hard to tell what she was feeling because she was non-stop busy that day. Patient stated that she was nauseous for a full three days, and she remembered that she did not eat much on the 24th either. So Patient stated that her nausea may have resolved on the third day after her injection, but it is unknown to her what day exactly that it resolved. Patient was also experiencing the general feeling of unwell from 22Dec2020 for a few days, but stated that by 25Dec2020 she felt okay. Patient also included that her left arm was also swollen, like her whole upper arm was swollen after the injection in Dec2020. Patient stated that she also experienced redness, there was a like a red mark that was further down her arm than the injection site in Dec2020. The outcome of soreness at site was recovering. Patient confirmed that both the swelling and redness had resolved in Dec2020.The outcome of fever was recovered on 24Dec2020. The outcome of general feeling of unwell and nausea was recovered on 25Dec2020.

The patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient did not have covid prior vaccination, and she was not tested for covid post vaccination. There were not known allergies. Concomitant medication included acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN), and colecalciferol (VITAMIN D). The patient experienced enlarged, sore lymph node right mid clavicle. 0.8mm on 11Jan2021 18:00. 61 2021-01-26 c-reactive protein increased unable to work; ESR of 124 mm/hr; CRP of 4 mg/dl; difficulty with ADLs; neck and leg muscle stiffnes... Read more
Close
unable to work; ESR of 124 mm/hr; CRP of 4 mg/dl; difficulty with ADLs; neck and leg muscle stiffness and pain; neck and leg muscle stiffness and pain; difficulty ambulating; neck and leg muscle stiffness and pain; fatigue; body aches; chills; sweats; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician (patient). A 61-year-old female patient (not pregnant) received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EH9899) via an unspecified route of administration at left arm on 18Dec2020 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. No medical history. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Patient had been otherwise well prior to receiving the bnt162b2 on 18Dec2020. Within 72 hours, she experienced fatigue, body aches, chills and sweats since 21Dec2020, though she was able to work Xmas week. On 31Dec2020, she contacted her PCP to report neck and leg muscle stiffness and pain, difficulty ambulating, fatigue, chills and sweats. She had a negative COVID test on 02Jan2021 and essentially negative blood work, other than an ESR of 124 mm/hr and CRP of 4 mg/dl. I had a negative PET scan on 12Jan2021. Currently, she had pain/stiffness in her neck and legs, and progressive difficulty w/ ambulation (both of which are worst in the early hours of the AM), and difficulty with ADLs since 31Dec2020. She had been unable to work since 03Jan2021. Her physician had not indicated or endorsed any relationship between her symptoms and the vax. She forewent dose 2 out of an abundance of caution. The adverse events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. No treatment received. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. No medications received within 2 weeks of vaccination. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: The events muscle stiffness , neck pain and gait disturbance appeared 13 days after administration of single dose BNT162B2. The Company considers that the events are less likely related to suspect BNT162B2 injection given the weak time association. The detailed clinical course and cause of the events would be helpful for further assessment. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

61 2021-02-16 white blood cell count increased 61 yo F with history of bilateral lung transplant 6/23/17 presented to ED on 2/4/21 with chief compl... Read more
Close
61 yo F with history of bilateral lung transplant 6/23/17 presented to ED on 2/4/21 with chief complaint of worsening shortness of breath, nausea and diarrhea for past week since receiving since receiving COVID-19 vaccine (Pfizer) on 1/28/21. Upon arrival to triage she was obviously dyspneic with significantly low oxygen saturations. O2 sats on arrival were 65%, improved to mid 90's with O2 6 liters per NC. Admitting diagnosis: hypoxic respiratory failure post COVID vaccine. Lab work shows an elevation of the BUN and creatinine at 31 and 1.71 which is slightly higher than her usual baseline levels. BNP is elevated at 2 448 with a mildly elevated troponin. Procalcitonin is also elevated. Patient's white blood cell count is 11.07. Full viral panel including COVID-19 is not detected. All blood cultures and respiratory cultures were negative. Patient chest x-ray shows numerous bilateral patchy opacities which is significantly different from her previous chest x-ray here. Empiric rejection treatment initiated including high dose methylprednisolone, plasmapheresis, IVIG, Thymoglobulin. She continued to decline and ultimately required intubation, proning and paralyzing on 2/8/2021 and then VV ECMO cannulation on 2/13/2021. EGD done 2/14/2021 as unable to pass the TEE probe during cannulation prior day (unable to complete due to abnormal anatomy). Acute pupil exam change in the early am hours of 2/15/2021 prompted urgent head CT which revealed catastrophic brain bleed. Brainstem reflexes were lost soon after. Despite placing an EVD emergently at bedside, brain stem reflexes were not recovered. GOL engaged and patient not an organ donation candidate. Therefore discussion with sister at bedside resulted in decision for cessation of life support. Patient expired shortly after support withdrawn and pronounced dead on 2/15/2021 at 11:11 AM.

numbness in her lips; swelling in her face; her tongue was feeling funny; her throat was feeling strange; she had itchiness to her right hand; started to develop hives; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 61-year-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, on 01Feb2021 at 09:00 (at the age of 61-years-old) at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE) on an unspecified date for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient experienced numbness in her lips, swelling in her face, her tongue was feeling funny, her throat was feeling strange, she had itchiness to her right hand, and started to develop hives on 01Feb2021. The clinical course was reported as follows: Approximately 3 hours after receiving the vaccine, the patient started to experience numbness in her lips, swelling in her face, her tongue was feeling funny, her throat was feeling strange, and she had itchiness to her right hand and started to develop hives. The patient stated that she cannot take diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL), but she did take cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC) to help with the symptoms. The patient was still having symptoms at the time of reporting. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of all of the events as aforementioned. The clinical outcome of numbness in her lips, swelling in her face, her tongue was feeling funny, her throat was feeling strange, she had itchiness to her right hand, and started to develop hives was not recovered. The batch/lot number for the vaccine, BNT162B2, was not provided and will be requested during follow up.

Close
At 0900 this morning my face next to the right side of my mouth started itching. I immediately felt it swell. I looked in the mirror and could see the left lower part of my face (lower cheek by the edge of my mouth) swell and my right upper lip started to swell. I took a Benadryl (25mg oral tablet) and my roommate drove me to the Emergency Room. That area of my face continued to swell and impacted my lower lip as well. My lips were numb and tingling and I could feel my cheek swell more inside my mouth as it was touching my teeth. I was monitored (vital signs and pulse ox) for 90 minutes and received 20 mg of pepcid oral tablet and 10 mg dexamethasone oral tablet- both 1x only.

Close
arm soreness at injection site (both vaccines); fever <100.6F x 24 hours; delayed headache x 3 days; enlarged left breast lymph nodes; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable health care professional (patient) reported for herself. A 61-year-old non-pregnant female patient (Patient was not pregnant at the time of vaccination) received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, lot number; EL0140, expiry date: unknown) via an Intramuscular on 28Dec2020 at 12:00 PM (at the age of 61-years-old) on Left arm at single dose and second dose (lot number; EL0142, expiry date: unknown) via an intramuscular route on 19Jan2021, at 08:30 AM on left arm at single dose; both for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included hypothyroidism and hyperlipidemia. Patient received unspecified concomitant medications (Other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination (unspecified)). Patient had no Allergies to medications, food, or other products. On an unknown date, the patient had arm soreness at injection site (both vaccines); on 20Jan2021, at 05:00 am, patient had fever less than 100.6 F x 24 hours, delayed headache x 3 days for 3 days, enlarged left breast lymph nodes (routine mammogram/sonogram was 2 days post injecting on left arm). No treatment was received for the adverse events. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has been tested for COVID-19. On 25Jan2021, patient underwent nasal swab (SARS-COV-2-BY-NAAT) test and resulted as negative. Seriousness of the events was reported as non-serious. Outcome of the events was recovered on an unknown date in Jan2021.

61 2021-03-10 peripheral swelling I am on infusion for severe psoriatic arthritis, and was doing well. Two days after injection it was... Read more
Close
I am on infusion for severe psoriatic arthritis, and was doing well. Two days after injection it was as if the effects of my infusions were cancelled. Extreme widespread stiffness, pain, joint swelling and heat, muscle weakness and pain. I also had swollen lower lip and have had an increase in headaches and nausea. Two weeks after the injection I awoke with my right arm swollen, hard, and itchy. The arm and my lips have resolved, but I am still having all the other problems. I have reported these symptoms to both my primary doctor and my rheumatologist.

Close
Received Pfizer vaccine at the Hospital on March 12, 2021 at 10:05 a.m. No reaction at that time. One hour later my ears and scalp began to itch. I had chills and severe nausea. Severe stomach cramping. Rash covering arms, legs, scalp, back and shoulders, Hives across chest and down both arms. Swelling and hives on palms of hands. Difficulty breathing. Symptoms began one hour after vaccine and continued to worsen. Was treated at Center for allergic reaction. Was given Benedryl and Famotadine, then released.

Close
Around 12;00pm on 3/13 , I felt muscle aches through back, shoulders, neck. Sore at site of vaccine and Headache. I felt tired and rested around 1:00p.m. Took 1 extra Strength Tylenol. Then started getting chills. Felt like I had swollen lymph node on ride side of throat when swallowing and had some pain going up into my ride ear. These symptoms lasted all evening. I didn't feel like eating dinner so rested and took 2 extra strength Tylenol at 9:00 p.m. and went to bed. Woke up early in morning with bad headache so I took another 2 extra strength Tylenol around 6:00am. I finally started feeling better around 9:00am.

The third day after shot, my fever went away and most of the body aches except I still have the headache and my arm is still hot, and swollen. Close
Pt called clinic stating that 12 hours after getting vaccine she noticed swelling of left breast and left arm. States that left breast noticeably bigger that the right. Almost double the size from the swelling. Left arm having swelling that started on the inner aspect of the upper arm and has spread down to the elbow. Stated it is tender to the touch and having pain in muscle with moving arm. Not hot to touch. No redness, rash, bruising, shortness of breath, or tightness in throat. Offered an appointment for evaluation at the clinic, but patient declined and preferred to continue to monitor at home. Discussed that if swelling increases or persist to contact the clinic fo an appointment.
61 2021-03-17 swelling bruise to her back; rash on back of neck/rash all over her body; redness; swollen area back of neck/... Read more
Close
bruise to her back; rash on back of neck/rash all over her body; redness; swollen area back of neck/ swollen area to her back; a lot itchier; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse (patient). A 61-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL9261), via intramuscular on left deltoid on 21Jan2021 at 14:00 at single dose to prevent Covid 19. The relevant medical history included obese from an unspecified date. Concomitant medications were reported as none. The patient experienced rash on back of neck/rash all over her body on 26Jan2021 at 19:30, swollen area back of neck/ swollen area to her back on 26Jan2021 at 10:00, redness on 26Jan2021 at 19:30, bruise to her back on 27Jan2021 at 10:00, a lot itchier in Jan2021. The nurse stated that she wanted to report that she had the Pfizer vaccine last Thursday. Stated that two days prior to the report that a rash started on the back of her neck and stated yesterday it was a lot itchier (as reported). Stated that she got undressed to put her PJs on and noticed that she had a fine raised rash everywhere and it was swollen. Stated that she went through her house to see if there was anything that could have caused it. Stated that she went to that doctor at the time of the report and was started on Prednisone taper. Stated that the doctor was concerned about the Prednisone reducing her ability to prevent antibodies. Stated that the doctor stated that he was unsure if she should get the second dose. Caller wanted to ask questions about these things. Had not started the Prednisone yet. Stated that there was redness to the back of her neck and back. Stated that the swelling was to the back of her neck and back. The events did not require a visit to Emergency Room but required a visit to Physician Office. Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks), no other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine. The event bruise to her back was reported as non-serious, while the events rash on back of neck/rash all over her body, swollen area back of neck/ swollen area to her back and redness were reported as serious due to medically significant. The outcome of the events was not recovered.; Sender's Comments: The Company cannot completely exclude the possible causality between the reported "rash on back of neck/rash all over her body", "swollen area back of neck/ swollen area to her back and redness" and the administration of the COVID-19 vaccine, BNT162B2, based on the plausible temporal association and lacking alternative explanations. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RA, IEC, as appropriate.

Close
Patient DOB 5/16/1959 received 1st dose of Pfizer Lot # ER8730 and was waiting in the 15 minute observation section when she stated that she felt "swelling of her face and tingling of her lips." Blood pressure was 196/98, HR 85, O2 97%, Temp 98.1. Patient was alert and oriented x 4. Patient stated that she was very anxious today and has allergies to dairy and pollen. Patient confirmed that her husband was on the way to pick her up and drive her home. EMT administered 25 mg of Benadryl PO at 12:32 pm. Patient observed for an additional 50 minutes until her husband arrived to pick her up at 1:22 p.m. Patient stated that she was feeling better and was able to walk unassisted with her husband. informed patient to go to ER or call 911 if symptoms worsen.

Close
Around 11, 11:30 the pain woke me up because it was so bad. It was hot and there was a big lump under my left arm pit (was very tender). I did not go to sleep like that. I did not have any symptoms by the time I went to bed. I also felt hot, and then cold, then hot, then cold, I would feel too hot and then too cold, freezing, I could not keep my temperature under control. I had to call in at work during the weekend I was feeling so bad. I had a lump under my armpit the size of a fist and I could not close my arm completely. It was huge and painful. I decided to go to a clinic over the weekend (unsure if Saturday or Sunday) to seek medical care and they ran some labs and a CBC to check for infection. All results came well no infection. They suggest to keep taking Tylenol. By Monday or Tuesday I started feeling well enough to return to work. The lump was still present and took about a week to go down. The injection site also was sore for a while, about a week also like the lump.

Immediately: headache, left eye pain, nausea, cold sensation and felt ?weird? but thought it was normal and thought I might feel flying for a bit but that it would wear off so I did not report feeling anything at the clinic. I left the clinic and got in the car to drive home and felt a weird feeling in my throat reminiscent of my esophageal spasm and then it felt like someone had their hand on my throat squeezing my throat and felt like I needed to take deep breaths to expand my lungs. Within a minute or two at most, my lips, tip of my tongue, tip of my nose and face beside my lips and under my cheeks started to tingle and go numb. My insides felt swollen. I had a doctors appointment and went there after picking my son up at home. I reported my feeling to my doctor who prescribed a steroid for 3 days and told me to also take Benadryl or Claritin, which I did. However, today is day 4 after my vaccine and today is the first day my insides don?t hurt.

I had swollen and very, very painful - the muscle on top of my shoulder (Trapezius) on the right side and I took Advil late at night time because it was so painful I couldn't sleep. My arm was not sore but that muscle was. That seemed to calm it down (Advil). The next morning, I was very swollen under my right armpit - I figured it was my lymph node. It was uncomfortable and very noticeable - quite swollen for three days. It took about a week to go back to normal. I also had abnormal fatigue and that took longer to resolve - that took about two weeks to be resolved.

61 2021-03-24 peripheral swelling Diabetes; unable to concentrate; arm is killing her; hands are swelled up; constipated; nausea; tigh... Read more
Close
Diabetes; unable to concentrate; arm is killing her; hands are swelled up; constipated; nausea; tightening of chest every so often; acid reflux; hot flashes; sweating; stomach aches; upper abdominal pain radiating to back; severe fatigue; Dizzy/dizziness; stomach feels odd; Headaches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 61-year-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-Biontech Covid-19 Vaccine, Lot Number: EN6198), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in upper left arm on 25Feb2021 9:00 (at the age of 61-year-old) as single dose for virus (COVID-19 immunisation). Medical history included chronic pain, pancreatitis, allergic to medications, old injury in her right arm, menopause and an ongoing mass in parotid lobe discovered in 2019 with CT scan. MRI performed in Mar2020 and CT scan in Oct2020. She stated that they are just watching it because it has not changed. Well defined borders are present, caller stated that doctor was unconcerned. Her mother had heart disease. Ongoing concomitant medications included ibuprofen for chronic pain and gabapentin from 2019 for chronic pain. The patient also took unspecified medication for pancreatitis. She has taken all kinds of stuff after pancreatitis but they do not work. The patient got deadly ill from the flu shot. Unsure of onset age, vaccine/brand name, or vaccination date. She stated that it was before 2003, possibly in the late 1990's or early 2000's. The patient had no history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine and no additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. On unspecified date the patient experienced diabetes; on 25Feb2021, the patient experienced dizzy, stomach feels odd, hot flashes, severe fatigue, sweating, stomach aches, acid reflux, upper abdominal pain radiating to back; on 26Feb2021 she experienced tightening of chest every so often; and in Feb2021, she had headache. It was further reported as follows: The patient stated that she took the Pfizer shot, clarified that she received the Covid-19 vaccine, on 25Feb2021, not quite 2 weeks ago. She stated that she had a little bit of a reaction after receiving the vaccination while there, so they were monitoring her. She has been experiencing hot flashes, sweating, and stomach aches for 2 days. She cannot get rid of hot flashes and that she has not had a hot flash in 2 years. She states that she has been down for 2 days with fatigue, that it's really bad. She is inquiring if the side effects that she is experiencing are common side effects and if it is ok to get 2nd shot. Her second vaccine is scheduled for 17Mar2021. She stated that she wanted to take the time to make a report as she is allergic to medications. While inquiring about dates of vaccines and side effects, she stated that she was experiencing tightening of chest every so often. She stated that she only had a few days of stomach pain and she has not stopped eating. She is unable to concentrate (unspecified date) and she has been experiencing headaches, experiencing them twice in 2 weeks. She also reported that she has been having upper abdominal pain radiating to her back. This concerns her, every time she gets it, it scares her. She had pancreatitis when she was 36. It is a nightmare thought. Does this sound like maybe she is possibly starting Diabetes? She reported that this shot has triggered everything. She has an old injury in her right arm. Her arm is killing her, her hands are swelled up, she has acid reflux again, she felt terrible. She stated that the dizziness not as strong as it was at the beginning. The fatigue it comes and goes and that she has spurts where she is energetic. She stated that it's more on than off. She is no longer having stomach aches. She compared the pain to pains of constipation. She also stated that she was constipated after receiving the vaccine on unspecified date. She had nausea at the beginning. The tightening of chest happened off and on, the last day that she experienced tightening of chest was on Sunday. For acid reflux, she is taking Zegerid as treatment, 20mg 20 mg capsules by mouth once daily as needed. She started this on 02Mar2021. She experienced upper abdominal pain yesterday and some this morning, but it was mostly in her back this morning. Her Sweating is off and on. She experienced headache just a couple of times but that she has not had one in a while. She stated that they lasted only an hour or two, and that she does not usually get headaches. She suggested that these may be due to sinuses and weather change. She has been taking Ibuprofen twice a day as treatment. But she normally takes Ibuprofen for chronic pain. Supposed to be 3 times a day but she does not want to take that much. She stated that all of this could also be stress related and that this could also be menopause. The patient recovered from stomach aches on 02Mar2021. The outcome of the events dizzy, sweating, tightening of chest every so often, upper abdominal pain radiating to back, headache was recovering; the outcome of stomach feels odd, hot flashes, severe fatigue, acid reflux was not recovered. The outcome of the remaining events was unknown.

61 2021-03-25 anaphylactic reaction Pasting clinicians note below: Patient is 61 year old female with hx of anaphylaxis presenting for C... Read more
Close
Pasting clinicians note below: Patient is 61 year old female with hx of anaphylaxis presenting for Covid-19 vaccine, Dose #1. She developed itching in there throat within 30 minute waiting period. She was taken to Rapid Response Room. Symptoms progressed from itchy throat, to congestion in throat/upper chest, clearing her throat, watery eyes. Then dry cough. No nausea, no vomiting, no light headed feeling. No facial swelling No hives. OBJECTIVE: Vitals - 154/97, 105, 100%RA Neck - Supraclavicular mild retractions, end inspiratory stridor CV: tachy, regular, no murmur pulm - diminished breathe sounds throughout, no wheezing. Speaking full sentences. Assessment/ Plan: Anaphylaxis to Covid-19 Vaccine: - emergency responders - epi 0.3 mg IM administered to L mid outer thigh at 9:35 am by me - epi 0.3 mg IM administered to R mid outer thigh at 9:41 am because symptoms not subsiding by me -benadryl 50 mg IM x 1 L deltoid by RN 9:45 am - Itching in throat subsided but still retracting and clearing throat so albuterol 3 puffs given at 9:50 am Vitals stable entire time (see midas report) EMS arrived to transport to local hospital.

chills; injection site pain; headache; muscle pain; fever/tiny fever; impacted lymph nodes/lymph nodes are impacted a little bit; nausea/feeling nauseous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 61-year-old female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection; Lot Number: EN6206) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left (left shoulder), at the age of 61-year-old, on 03Mar2021 19:00, as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was overweight, diagnosed COVID last Apr2020 she had it for 17 days and had every symptoms. The patient tried to give antibodies for many months and she was told she had two different kinds of antibodies which prevented her from doing that. The patient has long hauler symptoms which are nerve pain in her thighs and mouth. The patient's concomitant included an unspecified medication (she takes something but not relevant). The patient did not receive any vaccine within 4 weeks prior. The patient previously received shingles vaccine on 14Feb2020 and tetanus shot on an unspecified date (years ago) both given for immunization and her arm hurt/ pain at the injection site (if she touches it, it hurts). On 03Mar2021 at 7PM, after receiving first dose, she felt blah described as she developed injection site pain which is dissipating but still there, headache, muscle pain, tiny fever, impacted lymph nodes, nausea/ feeling nauseous which she didn't have before. The patient can get up and walk around. On 04Mar2021, the patient had chills in the afternoon. It was just a little fever. The patient took Tylenol and Advil in the afternoon and it helped it go away. The patient took one of each. It was reported that the COVID headache is like none other and she had the headache again. For the COVID headache if you take things it doesn't make it go away. When the patient said she had the headache again she meant she had the same headache that she had in April. The events did not require ER or physician office visit. Outcome of injection site pain was not recovered while it was unknown for the other events. The reporter assessed the events as non-serious. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Patient medical history was reported as none. Patient concomitant medications included calcium, ergocalciferol (VITAMIN D), multivitamin and probiotic. The patient previously took BNT162B2 (Comirnaty, Lot number: EJ1685) vaccination, intramuscularly to left arm on 22Dec2020 for COVID-19 immunization. On 12Jan2021 22:00, 12 hours after the second dose of vaccination the patient experienced with fatigue, fever (101.6), chills, shakes, muscle pain, joint pain, headache, foggy head, loss of appetite, nausea, sore arm at injection site (minor), swollen lymph gland under left arm. patient was on bed and felt dizzy after fever broke for about 24 hours. Seriousness was reported as non-serious. Patient received on advil at night for treatment of events. The outcome of events was recovered on an unspecified date. No follow-up attempts are possible, No further information available

61 2021-04-08 lymph node pain Developed fever up to 102 degrees F as of 9 PM on the day of vaccination, plus muscle and joint ache... Read more
Close
Developed fever up to 102 degrees F as of 9 PM on the day of vaccination, plus muscle and joint aches, chills, and headache. These symptoms continued the next day along with sore arm, and fever went up to 103.6 degrees F. By bedtime on the second day, March 16, fever, aches and pains, and headache were gone. However, I felt very fatigued and I was sweating profusely all night. I had to get up and change soaked clothing three times during the night. Within 3 days, my arm was still very sore and the lymph nodes in the armpit of the vaccinated arm became very sore. I also began having diarrhea several times per day on approximately the third day after vaccination and this has continued to the present.
61 2021-04-08 lymph node swelling About 36 hours after my first dose, I woke up very thirsty and with "gummy," sticky eyes. My moistu... Read more
Close
About 36 hours after my first dose, I woke up very thirsty and with "gummy," sticky eyes. My moisture-producing glands, particularly my salivary glands were significantly affected and I had, in effect, (drug-induced?) Sjogrens Syndrome. My salivary glands felt uncomfortable, perhaps because they were swollen. The symptoms have diminished somewhat in the past two weeks, but have not resolved. I visited my PCP on 04/02/2021 and she advised to see her again if the symptoms did not continue to resolve on their own. Note that in 2014, I had a similar, but more severe reaction to a single dose of Nitrofurantoin and regained nearly complete salivary gland function after 9-12 months.

61 2021-04-11 lymph node swelling Patient received her second Pfizer covid vaccine on Tuesday 4/6/21. She said she had been doing yard... Read more
Close
Patient received her second Pfizer covid vaccine on Tuesday 4/6/21. She said she had been doing yard work before she came to get her vaccine. After she received her vaccine she felt fine. On Tuesday night she started to feel some itchiness. She said the itchiness got worse over the next two days. She talked to her husband and he advised her to take Benadryl so she took two Benadryl. On Wednesday she had some soreness at her injection site. Very early Thursday morning she noticed a golf ball sized knot in her armpit. She said it was sore and if she rubbed it, it felt like it was pushing into her breast. She said it felt like pressure going all the way to her breast bone and along her esophagus. She ended up calling EMS and her blood pressure was up to 181/107 and had a high heart rate. She said she never had any hives but did have some throat, tongue, and lip swelling and said that her throat felt raw. The EMS gave her 2 nitroglycerin tablets and 5 aspirin. She spent Friday and Saturday in the hospital. She said the hospital did all kinds of cardiac tests on her and everything can back clear besides a leaky heart valve. She said she is feeling much better now and that the hospital was not sure if it was a reaction to the vaccine, something else, or a combination of things that caused it.

61 2021-04-12 lymph node swelling Two days after receiving the vaccine, the front of my neck developed a very itchy, warm rash, my lym... Read more
Close
Two days after receiving the vaccine, the front of my neck developed a very itchy, warm rash, my lymph glands on the right side of my neck swelled so much that it was difficult to swallow even liquids without pain, and I had a fever of about 100. The itchy area on my neck continued to worsen, and despite the application of OTC anti-itch medications and me taking Benedryl, it got larger and warmer, and the itching became even more severe. At one point my throat was so swollen, I started to think it was closing up and that I'd need to go to the hospital. The discomfort continued into the next day when I contacted Teledoc, and was prescribed an antibiotic, and prednisone, which helped. The itching is still present, but managed by regular spraying of an aerosol cortisone. And the swelling has gone, but there are slight scars like one would get from a scrape. My throat is much better, and my fever is gone.

A 61-year-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2; Formulation: Solution for injection), via unspecified route of administration on Left arm on 24Mar2021 12.00 at single dose for covid-19 immunization and second dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2; Formulation: Solution for injection), via unspecified route of administration on Left arm on 24Mar2021 12.00 at single dose for covid-19 immunization. Relevant medical history includes Von Willebrand Type 2 bleeding disorder. Concomitant medications include Lisinopril. It was reported that the next day after vaccine I had extreme hives, red welps all over by body from head to toe on 25Mar2021 at 13.00 PM and treated with Prednisone/Atarax and resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Prior to vaccination, the patient not diagnosed with COVID-19. Patient weather tested positive for COVID-19 since having the vaccine is unknown. Upon follow up on 31Mar2021, there wasn't side effects with the first shot, it was with the 2nd shot, developing rash on the second day, red rash, welts, swollen, severe scratch marks on chest, swelling on shoulders and welts, arms with welts and scratch marks, and major scratch marks and welts on lakes, and big old red patch on my left calf. The next day went to Clinic and saw a doctor, he couldn't even believe it, he was gasping at what he saw, gave me prednisone for severe allergic reaction, today is the last day of treatment, I started prednisone on Friday and the last day is today. It did take down swelling itching and pain, now I am left with patches, welts, scratches on my chest and red lesions and big red patch on my left calf. Can send pics if you want. I want to know how to get rid of the patches, or when will they go away? can you suggest what I can take? I am going to go to a haematologist next week, because I do have a bleeding disorder. It looks to me like these are going to be the scars and they are not going to go away. It feels like someone took their nails and just scratched., looks like they aren't going to go away. " Response: Spoke from attached document: explained that Pfizer is unable to provide treatment and management recommendations and referred to HCP. Offered to email document for review with HCP, and for links for latest information and reporting. Upon follow up on 31Mar2021, I had my 2nd vaccine of the Pfizer Vaccine on 24Mar2021 and the next day I started seeing a rash, mild rash and then on the 25mar2021 I had a full blown red rash all over my body and red lesions all over my leg and my back and red marks and scratches all over my chest, my back, legs and so I went to my doctor on the 26mar2021 they prescribed Prednisone and so I am on my last of the Prednisone, it downed the swelling and the itch but I still have red rashes and scratch and red marks all over my body, I had a severe reaction." Consumer stated, " I took pictures, so I can send them, so they can see what it did I don't know. Well I wanted to see like what Pfizer can do to help me, this is like not going away any time soon, I going to see another one of my doctor next week." Consumer was informed about the role of Pfizer Drug Safety and permission to probe: consumer stated, " Well actually I'm expecting a call from my doctor, I need to take his call." The outcome of the events for "Urticaria" was "Not recovered", for "Rash", "Skin lesion", "Swelling", and for "Reaction aggravation" was "Unknown". No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained. 61 2021-04-18 anaphylactic reaction anaphylaxis/anaphylactic condition; abnormal heart problems; vocal cord dyskinesia; SOB; extremely r... Read more
Close
anaphylaxis/anaphylactic condition; abnormal heart problems; vocal cord dyskinesia; SOB; extremely red all over body; Abnormal liver enzymes; Hr became Brady with widening if qtinterval; leg cramps; neuro s/s migraine severe; throat closed; Weight gain 15+ lbs on body non pitting edema; non pitting edema; extreme leg pain; breathing problems; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 61-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 27Mar2021 16:45 (Lot Number: er8733, expiration date was unknown) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included asthma, brain disorder, arthritis, vertigo. Patient had known allergies. It was unknown if patient had COVID prior vaccination. She was not pregnant at the time of vaccination. Patient did not have other vaccine in four weeks. She used other medications in two weeks. The patient experienced anaphylaxis within 5 minutes went home extreme leg pain. Her throat closed and she had short of breath (SOB). She had extremely red all over body. She went back to emergency department (ED). Electrocardiogram (EKG), X-ray and blood work were done. She had c/o leg cramps. Her weight gain more than 15 lbs on body with non-pitting edema. She received treatment for events. She had abnormal liver enzymes, abnormal heart problems and breathing problems. Anaphylactic condition was to step down was on bipap epi (Epinephrine injection) Benadryl 50 mg every 4 hours and intravenous steroids along with fluids. Renal replacement therapy (RRT) called the next day. Patient didn't remember exact cause. Neuro s/s migraine severe Ajovy taken Uberlvy and not else remembered (as reported). Heart issues maintained and pulmonary showed improvement. Ear, nose, and throat (ENT) consult with scope done showing vocal cord dyskinesia. Heart rate became brady with widening if qt interval. She transferred to telemetry 2 d and echo done. Monitor patient for low heart rate 24 hours. Patient released from hospital on 06Apr2021 evening. At home patient continue to have organs change every 24- 36 hours keeping video monitoring and pictures. All events occurred on 27Mar2021 16:45 and resulted doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, emergency room/department or urgent care, hospitalization/Prolongation of existing hospitalization (vaccine received during existing hospitalization), Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). The duration of hospitalization was 6 days. Patient tested COVID-19 via nasal swab on 01Apr2021 with negative result. Benadryl 50 mg she had around the clock, steroids and epi used as treatment. The outcome of all events was not recovered. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
61 2021-04-19 anaphylactic reaction Six days after my 2nd vaccine I had an anaphylaxis reaction. Out of the blue while I was driving my... Read more
Close
Six days after my 2nd vaccine I had an anaphylaxis reaction. Out of the blue while I was driving my face started to burn like acid was rubbed on it. It got really hot and turned very bright red. Then my lips began to feel like they had been sunburned badly. Then my forearms both started burning and also turned bright red. I was very anxious. Had two bouts of diarrhea. All this occurred within about a 20 minute time-frame. I chewed up 4 children's Benadryl (50mg) and the redness, burning and anxiousness subsided mostly. My heart rat was still over 100 bpm even after 6 hours. (Usually my HR is 68-70 bpm). I slept for 12 hours and the next day seemed fine. This has occurred two more times since that first time. The 2nd reaction being 5 days after that first one and the 3rd reaction being 5 days after that. Same reaction, same treatment and same outcome.

Medical history included known allergies: yes and hypertension. The patient was not pregnant. Concomitant medications included metoprolol succinate (TOPROL XL), lisinopril dihydrate (LISINOPRIL), and cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC). The patient had no other vaccine in 4 weeks. The events resulted in emergency room/ department or urgent care. Therapy for the events included prednisone, antihistamine, and intravenous (IV) fluid. The patient did not have covid prior vaccination and was not Covid tested post vaccination. Outcome of events was recovering. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.

A 61-year-old-female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: CR8732 or LR8732) first dose on 03Apr2021 08:30 on right arm at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing High blood pressure (Has had a long time), Breast cancer (Has had 6 years) and covid in Feb2021. History of all previously immunizations was No. Prior vaccincations wtihin 4 weeks was No. AE's following prior vaccinations was No. Concomitant medications included anastrozole (ARIMIDEX, strength 20 mg) for breast cancer (Has not taken the last 3 days, Did not want to take with the shot), bisoprolol fumarate, hydrochlorothiazide (BISOPROLOL HCT) for Blood pressure (States that she was taking 5-6.25mg and increased dose to taking 10 in the morning and 5 at night) and ongoing Vitamins. States that in Feb2021 had Covid and had gotten over that and was discharged. States that she might have had mild Covid and with all of the variances coming out, she wanted to get the vaccine. States that she got her first dose on Saturday (03Apr2021) and didn't know if she hadn't waited long enough. Caller states that she has been having terrible reactions. Has been having injection site pain but even had that with the flu shot. States that she has been experiencing tiredness, headaches, muscle pain, chills, joint pain, and lymph nodes under her arm were swollen where she got the shot. Has also been experiencing nausea and can hardly hold her head up. States that she slept all day yesterday, and slept all night. Woke up this morning feeling a little bit better, then the side effects took a hold of her again. Caller states that cancer meds made her gain weight and hasn't been able to get rid of it. Noticed Tiredness yesterday (04Apr2021) when she woke up. States that she had the vaccine on Saturday the 03Apr2021 at 8:30am, started to have headache that night. States when she woke up yesterday (04Apr2021), she started experiencing all of the other symptoms, tiredness, headaches, muscle pain, chills, joint pain, and lymph nodes under her arm were swollen where she got the shot. States that when she woke this morning, had thought everything was a little better but, then it hit her again. Clarifies she is still tired, and the headache still has not gone away. This morning (05Apr2021) she is having hot flashes, not so much the chills. The chills are still there but not nearly as bad, she just gets hot. She has been experiencing nausea and feeling unwell. States that the lymph nodes are not as bad, they are hurting but, not as bad. States that it is hopefully doing what it is supposed to do. States that she has been taking only Tylenol but has not taking it yet today. States that she is super scared to get the second shot. If this happened with the first shot, is terrified for the second shot. States that she has been taking Tylenol every four hours and is such a lightweight that she has only been taking one Tylenol every four hours. Caller states that she is supposed to be back 24Apr2021 for second shot but does not know if she can go through with it. States that this was recently increased when her blood pressure was out of control when she had gotten Covid. States that she was taking 5-6.25mg and her dose was increased dose to taking 10 in the morning and 5 at night. States that she is not taking as prescribed but she was too chicken to take the 10mg. States she will be back to see her doctor on 16Apr2021. States that she hates taking any medicine. Tests: States that she had bloodwork done Friday (02Apr2021) but has no idea of the results. States she will be seeing her doctor 16Apr2021 to go over the results. Vaccination facility type was Hospital drive up. Vaccine administered at military facility was No. No events required to ER. Caller states she has contacted her doctor to find out about her future vaccination. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

face and throat swelling and redness; face and throat swelling and redness; mild face swelling; lymph nodes swelling in armpits; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient).
