inflammation; sometimes I get a reaction in my ears if it flares up and gets hot/first shot it was really hot like a boil; sometimes I get a reaction in my ears if it flares up and gets hot/first shot it was really hot like a boil; skin is dry from being inflamed; skin is dry from being inflamed; skin reaction red rash under both armpits; skin reaction red rash under both armpits; swelling in arm; soreness in arm; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable nurse (patient). A 67-year-old female nurse reported for herself that she had received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, batch/lot number: EM9809), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 09feb2021 14:00 at single dose for prevent the covid virus. Medical history included female surgery. Concomitant medication included colecalciferol (D3) at 3000 iU, daily, macrogol 3350 (MIRALAX) at alternate day for female surgery. The patient's had a past drug included included Zyrtec for seasonal allergies like dust and stated that she took no Zyrtec at all for either shots. The patient stated that she takes macrogol regularly every other day for the last 5 years for a female surgery and her female surgeon says she needs it to stay out, but the ingredient is also in macrogol. The patient reported that she had both vaccinations and had the rosy arm pits red rash and sometimes she get a reaction in my ears if it flares up and gets hot. For 5 weeks she was taking children's Benadryl. The patient had a quicker reaction with the second dose and still had some lingering effects from the first dose when I got the second. On 09Feb2021 she had swelling in arm after shot and has been using a cool cloth on it and was better by the next day. The patient reported she still feels it though and it has been five weeks and she tries to turn arm and can still feel it but it is not bad. The patient stated a day later she had her first skin reaction which was a red rash under both armpits. The patient stated she waited because she wanted to see what reactions she would have with second dose. The reaction from first dose happened for three weeks. It was reported that she had been taking liquid Benadryl everyday sometimes during night and also cold wet compresses in armpits has helped with inflammation. The patient stated she called primary care doctor and talked to nurse to see if she should try some other medication before second shot and the nurse recommended, she should not get second shot that she should see an allergist. The patient stated she asked the nurse about the quality of first and second shot working together if she had waited and not got second shot and the nurse told her she would have to come back at least four days after the second shot was due or it would not work together. The patient stated she went ahead and got the vaccine and it has not been life threatening as of now. The patient stated she saw an allergist three days after second shot. The patient had rosy red inflamed armpits and when it would flare up her ears would get warm feeling, very hot, but not anywhere else and it was just mainly bilateral armpit and then sometimes ears would get hot. The patient then stated she would take Benadryl. The patient stated her primary care physician told her to try to take Allegra 24 hours but caller stated it did not work that it only worked for 12 hours and not the full 24 hours. The patient took the Allegra medication on Sunday morning and that it worked for her for about 12 hours and she knew she could not take any more Allegra but the Benadryl seemed to help. The patient reported her Allergist felt she made the right decision since her events are not life-threatening since it is not respiratory. It was reported that the Allergist saw her armpits agreed the children Benadryl was working and that she should stick with that. The patient then stated but it is not going away been like this the whole time since 02Mar2021 and still having a reaction in her armpits. The patient stated after the second shot the flare up was quicker because first shot was already in system still. The patient stated it is not a flare up like when someone cannot eat seafood and stuff like that. The patient stated she wanted to wait for second dose before contacting Pfizer to see what would happen. The patient stated she is really blossoming under the armpits and they are rosy, red but no blisters and her skin is dry from being inflamed all this time. The patient squeezes a rag under her armpits and that it is better during the day than at night, it is worse at night. The patient was only taking 20 mL of Benadryl in the morning and then evening before bed. It was reported that with the first shot right at the beginning she had to take Benadryl in the middle of the night as well but got to where she was taking it 12 hours apart before second dose. It was reported that she hopes she is not having to walk around with compresses in the summer as it is easier when it is cold and that she hopes this fazes. It was reported that she was noticing since she had not taken a shower or hot bath this morning that she had rosy red cheeks like a rosy red U on her face. The patient did not experience any swelling or soreness with second shot. The patient stated she experienced ears would get warm feeling very hot only six times and it was usually at night or in the morning from the second shot. The patient stated every once in a it while flare up from the first. The patient stated the hurt was always in the center of armpit not in the armpit. Caller stated thank goodness she can still shave. The patient stated past couple of days her skin has been dry. The patient stated she has used hand cream but is afraid to put anything else on it because of reaction. and she will probably put cream on it so it does not crack, it is very dry and it has not been dry like this. The patient stated she has been putting water on at night which could have dried it out. The patient stated soreness in arm happened right after first shot. The patient stated she did not want to double up on Allegra as she was not sure what the reaction would be. The patient stated the medical ingredient was Fexofenadine HCL 180 mg antihistamine and stated she only took one pill as it did not work. The patient was taking Children Benadryl 20mL and would take at least every 6 six hours and was trying to hold off to now taking it 12 hours and will use cold compress if she has to. The patient stated she had the Pneumonia shot and never had swelling. The patient was not recovered from soreness in arm, skin reaction red rash under both armpits, skin is dry from being inflamed and recovering from inflammation, outcome was unknown for sometimes I get a reaction in my ears if it flares up and gets hot/first shot it was really hot like a boil and swelling in arm. The reporter assessed events are related to drug. The outcome of the event inflammation was recovering, ear discomfort, Feeling hot, swelling in arm was unknown and rest of the events was not recovered.

microemboli.; some splinter hemorrhages; erythema and tenderness progressively over weeks of all her finger pads; erythema and tenderness progressively over weeks of all her finger pads; crop is elevated; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 67-year-old female patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 intramuscular, administered in left arm on 25Feb2021 12:00 (Lot number was not reported) as single dose for covid-19 immunization at age 67 years old. The vaccine was given in a Pharmacy or Drug Store. Medical history included APLA, hypothyroid, obesity, and allergies. The patient was not pregnant. No covid prior to vaccination and was not tested for covid post vaccination. Concomitant medications included warfarin sodium (COUMADIN); levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID); cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC); all taken for unspecified indications, start and stop date were not reported. No other vaccines administered in four weeks. The patient previously took erythromycin and PCP and experienced allergies to both. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 intramuscular in left arm on 04Feb2021 12:00 PM (at age 67 years old) for covid-19 immunisation. The patient with APLA on coumadin 1-2 days after receiving the vaccine developed erythema and tenderness progressively over weeks of all her finger pads, crop is elevated (as reported) and some splinter hemorrhages suspect microemboli. Just to left hand, systemically well. The adverse evemts occurred on 26Feb2021 12:00 PM. The AE resulted in: Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. No treatment was given to patient for the events. The patient had not recovered from the events. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

I don't know if this is related to the vaccine or not. I wanted to report it just in case. Vaccine was on Thursday noonish. Subsequent Sunday afternoon, 72-75 hours later, I detected a cold sore emerging, without known provocation: no walnuts, no chocolate, no strawberries, no excess sun exposure, no unusual stress, none of the normal triggers. Valacyclovir didn't help much this time, although it normally stops the lesion immediately. Hadn't had a cold sore since one in August, caused by walnuts.

There was no nodule in the CT scan from Februrary 9,2021 .4/3 fingers less purple and moving some. Saw Doctor 4/5, she wanted pulmonary appointment asap. 4/3 through 4/12 afterbiib fatigue. A 67-years-old non-pregnant female patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6201 and Expiration Date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration in in Arm Left on Feb2021 10:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included high blood pressure, allergies to wheat, rye, oats, avoid milk and eggs by choice, neuralgia, back injury, constant tazer like hum , spinal operation , joint noise, pain, pain in extremity, peripheral swelling all from an unknown date and un-known if ongoing I am one that usually has severe arm pain and swelling. Concomitant medication(s) included lisinopril (LISINOPRIL); venlafaxine (VENLAFAXINE); pantoprazole sodium sesquihydrate (PROTONIX); estradiol (DOTTI); cannabis (CANNABIS) all taken for sleep disorder, start and stop date were not reported. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient not tested for COVID-19. It was reported that normal existing nerve pain right side of body from high waist to toes, constant tazer like hum from back injury/surgery. On 11Feb2021, the Hum buzz was now on both sides of body started at 18 hours after vaccine. Started above shoulders slowly poured down my back in 15 band. now mixing with pain I already have. Can't pin point pain to anything else but vaccine, like a cold, fever or activity. It's continuing down both legs into feet more each day. the upper edge was holding at her hips not moving down. She was one that usually has sever arm pain and sewlling, but just a tiny bit with this vaccine. Taking nightime meds during the day (cannibus 1-6.5 mg gummie bear eaten) need 3 for sleeping at night. Patient did not receive any treatment for adverse event. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

Shaky; Muscles and nerves seemed to be locking up like almost paralyzed; swollen lymph nodes; injection site redness; severe allergic reactions; slight dizziness; severe headache; nausea; weak; tired; feverish; sweat; had pain at the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine injection site; right arm started to swell; chills; extreme muscle pain; certainly extreme and joint pain; Heart beat seemed to speed up; Has not been able to walk or move body in normal fashion; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient herself) A 67-year-old female consumer received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, lot number: EP7533) a week ago via an unspecified route of administration on 02Apr2021 at 13:45 hrs on the right upper arm as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported.When caller was 18 they required a booster for Small pox and caller received the small pox booster on the leg in the same site where it was given at age 5. Caller's leg swelled up to 5 times the normal size, at the time caller was 18 years old.Took a long time for swelling to go away, a couple weeks. Caller requires it hindered sports activities during this time. On 02Apr2021, the patient started reported slight dizziness, severe headache, Shakiness, nausea, weakness, tiredness, have been feverish, pain at the injection site and stated that her right arm started to swell. The patient stated that through out the night of 02Apr2021, she had extreme muscle pain, certainly extreme and joint pain that was also extreme and heart beat seemed to speed up within the first hour and by the end of the hour. On 03Apr2021, the patient stated that her muscles and nerves seemed to be locking up like almost paralyzed. The patient described the events she experienced slight dizziness and didn't worry because it wasn't major and caller was driving herself and with in an hour the dizziness got worse. Caller had severe headache and had to drive home a significant distance and the time the caller got home, she reports being shaky, dizzy, had headache, nausea, was weak and tired and must have been feverish. Caller reports she must have been feverish because she was drenched in sweat by the time she got home and it was a 2 hour drive home from the vaccine administering facility. Caller had pain at the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine injection site, and caller's right arm started to swell.Caller clarified that the injection site was in the right upper arm, doesn't know what the muscle is called. Caller says she couldn't see if her arm was getting red, caller has some discs out in her neck and is unable to look at the arm. Caller could feel the injection site on her right arm was swollen and swelling. Caller reports fever was gone and fever got replaced with chills later on. Caller reports there was progression of the symptoms after the first hour. Caller states the information provided thus far was the first hour of her experience and through the night a lot of other things changed and added.Through the night caller had extreme muscle pain, certainly extreme and joint pain that was also extreme. Muscles and nerves seemed to be locking up like almost paralyzed: By the next morning, after caller had the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccination, states she was not a doctor but all of her muscles and nerves seemed to be locking up like caller was almost paralyzed. Caller reports she couldn't move, couldn't get out of bed. It took a long time to get caller's fingers and toes moving and the rest of the body, but fingers and toes were the first ones. Caller was able to kind of release from muscle cramping. Whatever was going on, caller says can't tell exactly what was going on, does not have a Doctor in the home. States the information given should cover that part of the experience. Through the night had extreme muscle pain, certainly extreme and joint pain that was also extreme: Reports since the morning after receiving the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine, caller has had continued muscle pain, although not as extreme, its pretty extreme, and join pain. The patient has not been able to walk or move body in normal fashion. The patient stated that she had every side effect listed on the fact sheet at the top minus the swollen lymph nodes and injection site redness and she had two of the side effects listed under the severe allergic reactions. The patient wanted to know whether it is safe to receive the second dose of the vaccine. The patient lives in an isolated area where all through COVID-19 she tried to get information from the local medical clinics and they did not seem to stay informed. Caller states she has a doctor's appointment, and she will let them know the side effects she experienced after the first dose but she is not confident in the recommendations they might provide. Patient was given a list of side effects to look for, ones they were assuming, doesn't know if the hand out was published by Pfizer or not.The hand out listed emergency kind of side effects people were experiencing.Caller reports they are over age 65 range and knew a lot of people before her who had the Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine and said they only had injection site soreness. Caller was expecting the same reaction, caller was told by the Doctor she was in pretty good shape. Caller reports she had most all of the reactions except anaphylactic reaction of not breathing after receiving first dose Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccine. Caller is nervous about going for the second round of the Pfizer Covid Vaccine, is not sure how to proceed and would like that information. The case was assessed as serious medically significant for the event paralysis. It was reported that patient took Aspirin as treatment medication for pain. The outcome of the events was resolved for fever and nausea, resolving for swelling arm, unknown for swollen lymph nodes, Chills , Vaccination site pain, injection site redness, severe allergic reactions, sweat, shaky feelings, heartbeat increased, movement disorder and not resolved for all other events.

67 2021-04-24 peripheral swelling blood clot; Right leg swelled and achy; Right leg swelled and achy; This is a spontaneous report fro... Read more
Close
blood clot; Right leg swelled and achy; Right leg swelled and achy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable nurse (patient). A 67-year-old female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/Lot Number: EP7534),dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 16Mar2021 (at the age of 67years) as single dose for Covid-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing Beta thalassemias. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient stated she has never had a problem with vaccinations, and she gets the flu vaccine every year. The patient reported that after the first injection coincidentally she did develop a blood clot in her lower leg. She thinks that it was due to a plane ride, but she has never had a blood clot before the injection. She added that she had the first dose on 16Mar2021 and developed a clot in a week. She further clarified that she got her first injection on 16Mar2021 and realized when she went on a flight, which is not that far she developed that clot and was having problems shortly after flight home on 24Mar2021 where her leg swelled up and she is on blood thinners since she went to the emergency room. She added that she developed the clot sometime between that flight and 02Apr2021. She had a doppler study on an unspecified date and it showed a blood clot. She stated that the outcome was she does not have the blood clot (as reported) but she will be on blood thinners and she needs to follow up on her scan to see if the clot issue is resolved but she will not have a doppler scan for another month or two and the blood thinner she is taking is Xarelto. She also stated that her right leg swelled up and it felt like a log. She reported it felt achy and swollen quite a bit from knee down and her leg was achy. It started between 24Mar2021 and by time she went to the emergency room she was not getting better. She had her symptoms for a week and toward the end of the week she thought she had a blood clot since it was not getting better it just got worse. She added that right now it is not swollen but she has been supine, and she does believe that it is better. The outcome of events was recovering. (As reported "outcome is unknown but pretty sure it has improved because of the blood thinners"./She stated she does not think it has resolved because it takes time for clots to resolve./She added that right now it is not swollen but she has been supine, and she does believe that it is better.) The reporter stated for the seriousness criteria for event blood clot: she believes as a nurse that any blood clot is extremely dangerous, and she was not hospitalized but obviously a blood clot is serious, and she could have ended up with pulmonary embolism. The seriousness for events right leg swelled and achy was reported as medically disabling. Causality assessment: Patient stated for the blood clot she has doubts if it was related to the vaccine but is it something that should be known about; for the leg swelling and achy she has doubts but it could have been the plane ride.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information, the reported events are most likely related to an intercurrent or underlying condition which is unlikely related to the suspected drug. The plane ride may provide an explanation for the events. The case will be reassessed if additional information becomes available.

Left eye lower lid was very swollen, it got worse; It is not like a small growing, it is really big and all the way to the cheek bone; high fever; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer(patient) reported that a 67 years old female patient received 2nd dose of PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE BNT162B2 on 05Apr2021 at single dose on left arm for covid-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant drug were not reported. Caller states the thing is, on Monday 05Apr2021 she had her second Pfizer Covid vaccine and Monday afternoon she was okay, states from Monday night up until yesterday she had a very high fever, states right now it is reduced, she knows that is sort of normal, but states on Tuesday afternoon on left side of her eyelid is swollen very badly, it got worse. She got this Less than 24 hours of having the vaccine it has to be related to the vaccine, she never had this before. It is not like a small growing, it is really big and all the way to the cheek bone. Outcome of the event fever was recovering, for other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

face swelled up, numbness and red on left side; face swelled up, numbness and red on left side; sinus infection; Shortness Of Breath; pounding in my chest/throbbing in her chest; ringing in ears; flared up some digestive issues / digestive disturbances; flared up some digestive issues / digestive disturbances; red on left side/face redness; exhausted all the time; This is spontaneous report received from contactable female consumer (patient) reported herself. A 67 years old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number EN6199) on 10Mar2021 17:30 at age of 67 years old at single dose in right upper arm for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included: last year February, she was really sick with bad sinus infection not knowing about COVID at the time. Sometime later she got these horrible digestive attacks, ended up in her stomach and esophagus, horrible attacks where she couldn't breath, she has had acid reflux in the past. digestive problems stayed with her a really long time, they did and endoscopy and put her on amitriptyline 10mg daily, continuing to take this medication for hypersensitivity. She tested in April last year, it was negative (not detectable). There was no history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. Concomitant medications were not reported. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). No adverse events (AE) following prior vaccinations. Patient had first Pfizer covid vaccine on 10MAR2021, approximately 10 days to 14 days after the vaccine her face swelled up, numbness and red on left side, went to see my doctor, he treated her with steroid and antibiotic for sinus infection, at the same time she had some shortness of breath and pounding in my chest, and had and still have ringing in ears since then, it kind of flared up some digestive issues she had last year. If she back up to last year February, she had a bad sinus infection, went to see allergist, family doctor and ENT, all treated her for sinus' before covid testing was even a thing, they didn't think of covid testing at the time. It ended up in her stomach and esophagus, horrible attacks where she couldn't breath, they did and endoscopy and put her on amitriptyline 10mg daily, continuing to take this medication for hypersensitivity. In March2020 her husband came home with covid, after that, talking to his doctor, she brought him meals outside of the door, it occurred to her that queried if this could have been covid. She tested in April last year, it was negative (not detectable), they were still not sure if it could have been covid. She was supposed to get the second vaccine, she postponed it, the numbness and swelling of face is gone, next shot was tomorrow. Since this was a delayed reaction, typically one to three days would be a reaction to the vaccine. she didn't associate it with the vaccine, asked if it could have been from the vaccine. She wanted to make sure that she was safe to get the second one. Response: Spoke from EUA factsheet for Recipients and Caregivers: LAB-1451-4.0 Revised: 06 April 2021: Sections: who should not get the PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE and what the risks of the PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE were. Spoke from attached VR Consumer- Pfizer cannot assess causality (i.e., cannot assess if what you described/are experiencing is associated with the Pfizer BioNTech Covid 19 vaccine). Your doctor/healthcare provider is in the best position to assess and advise you as your doctor/healthcare provider is most familiar with your medical condition, clinical history, how your treatment has been conducted and any relevant information to your specific case. Patient calling about the COVID vaccine. She states that she had the first vaccine 10MAR2021, and 10 days afterwards her face swelled up. She had numbness in it and redness. She went to the doctor and the doctor thought that maybe it was a sinus infection. So she was treated for that. She states that she did have a few other symptoms. To make a long story short, she was suppose to have the last vaccine last Friday. She postponed it for a week (postponed getting the second shot for a week). She wants to know what Pfizer thinks about her getting her second vaccine and her side effects. She says that somewhere between the 10th and 14th day, after receiving the vaccine the symptoms started and that was why she did not think she had a reaction to the vaccine. She has not had anything like that before, it was sort of a delayed reaction. She states she is better now. She had a few symptoms after the face things started and the only thing that she still has now is ringing in her ears. She states it all started around the same time as her face issues, or might have started a little after that. She confirms everything but ringing in her ears have completely resolved. She states that she did have some digestive disturbances, shortness of breath, and throbbing in her chest after receiving the vaccine. She asks if she can go back a little bit to explain. She states that last FEB2020 she was really sick with bad sinus infection not knowing about COVID at the time. She went to her allergist, then her family doctor, and then an ENT. She states that it was nothing like she has ever had, it was really bad. Sometime later she got these horrible digestive attacks, she has had acid reflux in the past but it was nothing like this. In March her husband had COVID and tested positive for COVID. She decided to get tested and she tested negative. She wonders if she had COVID earlier but at that time they were not testing for COVID. Her digestive problems stayed with her a really long time, and she was still on the medications her gastrointestinal doctor put her on. They are hypersensitive esophageal medication. She states that she has been exhausted all the time. The rest of the story she has told already. She states that after the face thing happened she started getting those digestive issues again. Her friend suggested that she call Pfizer, so she is doing that. She confirms that the vaccine card does not have an expiration date, NDC, or dosing information. She states it says 0.3 ml, but she cant see a point, so she doesn't know if its just 03. She states she got the vaccine to lessen her chances of getting a severe disease, in case she ends up in the hospital. Also, to keep herself safe from other people. She states she wants the second one because husbands works with the public and she wants to be protected when he comes home. She states that she has those gastrointestinal disturbances and is on amitriptyline 10 mgs for that. She states she also takes something for her thyroid but she has no major health issues. She states that she had a endoscopy and a colonoscopy as well as blood work done but she doesn't have any of the results because they are in her Beaumont chart where she actually got the vaccine. All of this was pre-vaccine so she doesn't know how relevant it is. The patient did not require a visit to Emergency Room, but visit to Physician Office. The only thing similar had a sister who reacted to a shingles vaccine, She has no information about her sisters reaction to the vaccine. Outcome of event ringing in ears was not recovered, for others was recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

A 67-years-old female patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EN6203, expiration date not reported), on towards side of muscle in right arm via intramuscular on 02Mar2021 14:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included female surgery (caller stated she takes Miralax regularly every other day for the last 5 years for a female surgery and her female surgeon says she needs it to stay out but the ingredient is also in Miralax. Caller then stated she knew it was not that ingredient causing the reaction), pneumonia (Caller stated she had the Pneumonia shot). Concomitant medications included colecalciferol (D3) at units everyday from an unspecified date and macrogol 3350 (MIRALAX) taken for female surgery. The patient previously took zyrtec [cetirizine hydrochloride] for seasonal allergies like dust (Caller stated she usually takes Zyrtec for seasonal allergies like dust. Caller stated she took no Zyrtec at all for either shots) and received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/Lot Number: EM9809), at the age of 67-years on bicep left arm upper muscle on 09Feb2021 14:00 for Covid-19 immunisation. On an unknown date the patient experienced skin reaction red rash under both armpits, soreness in arm, ears would get warm feeling very hot, swelling in arm, skin is dry from being inflamed. The report received as, Caller received the COVID vaccine and stated she had rosy red, inflamed armpits and when it would flare up her ears would get warm feeling, very hot, but not anywhere else and it was just mainly her bilateral armpits and then sometimes ears would get hot. She had second COVID 19 vaccine and also had first one. The first dose was on 09Feb2021 and she had swelling in arm after shot and has been using a cool cloth on it and was better by the next day. Caller then states she still feels it though and it has been five weeks. Caller states she tries to turn arm and can still feel it but it is not bad. Caller states a day later she had her first skin reaction which was a red rash under both armpits. She called primary care doctor and talked to nurse to see if she should try some other medication before second shot and the nurse recommended she should not get second shot that she should see an allergist. She got to building for second shot and talked to nurse there. She asked the nurse about the quality of first and second shot working together if she had waited and not got second shot. the nurse told her she would have to come back at least four days after the second shot was due or it would not work together. She went ahead and got the vaccine and it has not been life threatening as of now. She saw an allergist three days after second shot. She had rosy red inflamed armpits and when it would flare up her ears would get warm feeling, very hot, but not anywhere else and it was just mainly bilateral armpit and then sometimes ears would get hot. She would take Benadryl and her primary care physician told her to try to take Allegra 24 hours but caller stated it did not work that it only worked for 12 hours and not the full 24 hours. She took the Allegra medication on Sunday morning and that it worked for her for about 12 hours and she knew she could not take any more Allegra but the Benadryl seemed to help and her Allergist felt she made the right decision since her events are not life-threatening since it is not respiratory. The Allergist saw her armpits agreed the children Benadryl was working and that she should stick with that, but it is not going away been like this the whole time since 02Mar2021 and still having a reaction in her armpits, after the second shot the flare up was quicker because first shot was already in system still, it is not a flare up like when someone can not eat seafood and stuff like that. She still has a rosy armpit and probably will not see her HCP unless she gets bad but she will go to Allergist. She wanted to wait for second dose before contacting Pfizer to see what would happen. She is really blossoming under the armpits and they are rosy red but no blisters and her skin is dry from being inflamed all this time. She squeezes a rag under her armpits and that it is better during the day than at night, it is worse at night. She is only taking 20 mL of Benadryl in the morning and then evening before bed. The first shot right at the beginning she had to take Benadryl in the middle of the night as well but got to where she was taking it 12 hours apart before second dose. She hopes she is not having to walk around with compresses in the summer as it is easier when it is cold and that she hopes this fazes. Since she had not taken a shower or hot bath this morning that she had rosy red cheeks like a rosy red U on her face. Caller states her sister asked what did she did and she said nothing. Swelling in arm was from the first shot it was really hot like a boil but it was not red it just felt hot, she used a cold compress during the night like a washrag and by the next day it was fine. She got the shot on the left arm on purpose because she was left handed and could move it more but noticed the swelling stayed a while. When she got the second shot she asked the nurse to give in her back upper part of bicep in arm muscle since it was a better location and it did not swell up and it did not hurt. She can still feel exactly where she got the first shot. Swelling in arm was not terrible. her allergist felt she made the right decision since it is not life threating like respiratory related or closing of throat like food allergies just uncomfortable and annoying. Skin reaction red rash under both armpits was the event started the first day after the first shot then still having reaction from the second shot. She had the reaction a couple hours later and did wait half hour before leaving after getting the shot with the second shot she did not experience any swelling or soreness. The reason she went ahead and got the second shot at the medical building was she asked the nurse how many people had skin reaction before second shot. Ears would get warm feeling very hot, she only experienced it six times and it was usually at night or in the morning from the second shot. Every once in a it while flare up from the first. The hurt was always in the center of armpit not in the armpit. Skin was dry from being inflamed from past couple of days her skin has been dry. She has used hand cream but is afraid to put anything else on it because of reaction. The serious criteria is just annoying. She will probably put cream on it so it does not crack, it is very dry and it has not been dry like this. she has been putting water on at night which could have dried it out. Some days is worse than others more red and this was persisting. The second shot is much better and that she does not feel it at all. She can still feel where the vaccine went in left arm. It is annoying but it does not keep her from moving her arm and it has been five weeks. Since it is not going away it is serious. The soreness had not gone away before she got the second shot so double whammy. She guesses right now it is uncomfortable and that she has had better days. She is not taking Benadryl in middle of day like before but it is itchy so she is going to go out in the cold and work in yard, before first week or two she would use cool compresses all day and take Benadryl during day and then at night it petered out. She is hoping it will fade out eventually. Caller stated that the seriousness criteria is medically significant. She is taking Children Benadryl 20mL and would take at least every 6 six hours and was trying to hold off to now taking it 12 hours and will use cold compress if she has to. her primary care physician told her to try to take Allegra 24 hours but caller stated it did not work that it only worked for 12 hours and not the full 24 hours. She took the Allegra medication on Sunday morning and that it worked for about 12 hours and she knew she could not take any more Allegra. The medical ingredient was Fexofenadine HCL 180mg antihistamine. She only took one pill as it did not work. she had not had an an anaphylactic reaction yet. She is taking Children Benadryl 20mL and would take at least every 6 six hours and was trying to hold off to now taking it 12 hours and will use cold compress if she has to. No follow-up attempts are possible. Concomitant medications included clopidogrel bisulfate (PLAVIX) taken for stroke from 2007 to an unspecified stop date; and acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN (E.C.)) taken for stroke from 2007 to an unspecified stop date. The next day on 04Mar2021, the patient had a swollen submandibular gland that got bigger. She could feel her mouth getting bigger. The patient was admitted into the hospital on 07Mar2021 and released on 09Mar2021. She was readmitted to the hospital on 11Mar2021 until 18Mar2021. The patient went back into the hospital on 21Mar2021 and released 20Apr2021. The gland was removed on 13Apr2021. She developed a blood clot. She went to the emergency room and was sent home on Xarelto. The patient mentioned that she received the 1st dose of the vaccine on 03Mar2021 and came down ill with something not related to the vaccine. She was hospitalized for 4 weeks and ended up missing her 2nd dose appointment on 24/Mar/2021. She would like to get her 2nd dose but she is now 5 weeks overdue for it. She mentioned the hospital is recommending that she restart her vaccination. She is looking for guidance from Pfizer. The patient underwent had CT and MRI of left arm/wrist which she does not have results to provide. Event relatedness to vaccine was unknown for events, swollen submandibular gland that got bigger, left hand was edematous and cold, left hand pain and blood clot. The outcome of the event blood clot swollen submandibular gland was recovered with sequel on unspecified date, the outcome of ill feeling was unknown and the outcome of the rest of the events was recovering.; Sender's Comments: The 67-year-old female patient had medical history of stroke. Based on information available, the reported thrombosis and other events were unlikely related to the vaccine of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE). This case will be reassessed should additional information become available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Fever; Chills; Lack of appetite; Tired; Pain in the arm; It looks normal just little tender around the injection site; Injection arm swollen, red, and sore; Injection arm swollen, red, and sore; Temperature going up and down; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient).A 67-years-old female patient received BNT162B2, first dose via intramuscular, route of administration in Arm Left on 16Apr2021 11:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0169) as first dose, 0.3 ML single for covid-19 immunization. The patient Medical history included ongoing chemotherapy and did have COVID-19 Virus in Dec2020.Concomitant medications included everolimus 7.5mg and Aromasin 25mg(both will take for the rest of her life).The patient takes a lot of vitamins to keep her immunity up. On 17Apr2021 the patient experienced fever, chills, lack of appetite, tired , pain in the arm it looks normal just little tender around the injection site, injection arm swollen red and sore , temperature going up and down. Caller waited three to four days. Then looked in a mirror and saw her arm was all red and swollen. Waited another day to see what would happen and it got worse. Went to urgent care. Doctor had seen some bad reactions, but stated caller's was the worst. Maybe a week ago, her arm was back to normal. Second dose COVID-19 vaccine was scheduled for tomorrow and she wants to know if this was too soon. Stated she was also on a chemo pill. Doesn't know if that has anything to do with it. She was taking a lot. Week after the COVID-19 Vaccine, she went to urgent care because her arm was still sore and swollen. Doctor prescribed Benadryl, antibiotic, and a cream. Cream was to put on the swelling part of her arm. Unable to provide product name of cream. Just finished the antibiotic four days ago. If she presses on the spot, it was still a little tender, but it wasn't like before where she couldn't even touch it. She would say five to six days prior to today, her arm was back to normal. About 4 days ago patient finished her antibiotics. Her arm just went down. The First noticed she was sick when she had chills and couldn't get warm. Was very cold. Turned up the heat and was under blankets. Temperature was 102 and was thinking about going to the emergency room. Got out of covers and took a cool bath and her temperature went down. Next day, 18Apr2021, temperature was back up to 102. Was taking an aspirin and drinking water trying to get her temperature right. Had five to six days of temperature going up and down. By the time she went to urgent care, which was seven days after the vaccine, she wasn't having fever or chills. stated chills coincided with the fever. Recovered completely from fever and chills and Loss of appetite as long as she had fever and chills, she wasn't hungry. Had it for about 5-7 days. Recovered somewhat. She still has an appetite, but was not eating s much. Stated she was overweight. On 24APR2021, outcome of events pyrexia, Chills, Lack of appetite, Tired and Temperature going up and down was recovered and outcome of other events was unknown. Follow-up attempts are needed. Further information is expected.

She reported increased liver enzymes and white count. They didn't rule out Covid illness. Caller has an opportunity to receive her second dose this Saturday, but doesn't know if she should? Medical history included right lower lobe wedge resection, adenocarcinoma of lung since 2021, Malignant neoplasm upper right lung, hypothyroidism, pure hypercholesterolemia. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered: Hospital. No other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Concomitant medications included pravastatin (PRAVASTATIN); levothyroxine sodium (SYNTHROID). The patient experienced 4 days later woke to weakened joints, severe pain and swelling both knees, upper arms, shoulders on 24Apr2021 08:00 with outcome of not recovered. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included physical therapy: unknown on 2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events. The events were serious due to disability. The adverse event result in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Treatment received for the adverse event included: receiving physical therapy, awaiting blood work. Date of start of drug: 07May202101:45 PM. Anatomical Location: Arm Right. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. 67 2021-06-02 peripheral swelling "burning sensation in my upper arm"; her foot swelled; below her knee to her ankle, was hurting; lef... Read more
Close
"burning sensation in my upper arm"; her foot swelled; below her knee to her ankle, was hurting; left arm was tingling; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 67-years-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER- BIONTECH COVID- 19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 04Apr2021 at the age of 67-years-old as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER- BIONTECH COVID- 19 VACCINE, Solution for injection) on an unspecified date. On an unspecified date, the patient experienced burning sensation in her upper arm, her foot swelled, below her knee to her ankle, was hurting and left arm was tingling. The reporter was who had both doses of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. She stated, she didn't get sick after having my vaccines like everyone else did, she came home and cooked dinner. She went to the ER on saturday morning because her feet had swollen, and she had a weird feeling in her upper arms. They did blood work, and everything came back normal. She still having some burning sensation in her upper arm. Her daughter saw on social media that some people after having the vaccine could stick stuff to their arm where they got the shot. So, they tried it and she can stick a fork and a small copper battery to my arm. She placed a small battery and fork on her arm, and it stayed on her arm, like a magnet, after the second vaccine. She was not sure if she could do this before so it may not be related to the vaccine. She does not have anything bad to say about the vaccine. She just wanted to let know incase someone else called in and had the same thing happening with them. She talked with my doctor about it, and they didn't know if it could be caused by the vaccine or not. They thought that maybe she just has a lot of electricity in her body. She does not know anyone else who got the Pfizer vaccine, or she would ask them to test it out and see if the same thing happened to them but everyone, she knows has gotten the Moderna vaccine. She just wanted to call and see if this had happened with anyone else. The reporter questioned, is there any information on magnetic effects at the injection site after receiving vaccination with the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine? Response received with; we were not aware of any properties of the content of the vaccine that would suggest magnetic effects at the site of injection. As of 30Ap2021, a search of our safety surveillance database for Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine revealed no spontaneous reports of magnetic properties at injection site since the market introduction (including emergency use authorization) of Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. Also, a search of the published medical literature on 19May2021 failed to identify relevant information on this topic. Therefore, we are not aware of any information regarding events of magnetic effects at the site of injection. We kindly refer you to your healthcare provider for any follow-up questions you may have. Reason for no lot number of Pfizer vaccine, for Covid was caller unwilling to complete the report. Patient history and investigation assessment was not provided. The patient stated she was fine and had no side effects. Patient stated, last week, on friday, her foot swelled. Reclarified, below her knee to her ankle, was hurting. Patient stated her left arm was tingling and she had a burning sensation, specifically in the upper arm. Patient stated she went to the emergency room and she states everything was fine. Patient states she also went to her doctor. Reclarified, Patient reported that she placed a small battery on her arm, and it stayed on her arm, like a magnet. Patient stated that she put a fork on her arm, and that stuck to her arm as well. Patient stated she took a picture. Patient stated when she went to the doctor, her doctor told her that her body has a lot of electricity, and that was why he thinks that those things are sticking to her arm. Patient stated she was fine, but those things that are attaching to her body, that has never happened before. Patient clarified that she saw some videos on social media, which was a website on the internet. Patient stated that she saw videos of people who had batteries, stuck to their arms. Patient could not provide any specifics for these people. Patient stated that her doctor said she has a lot of electricity in her body. Patient asked if Pfizer has ever heard of that side effect? Patient stated she read a lot about the side effects of the vaccine online. Patient agreed to be transferred to medical information. Patient stated she wanted to make Pfizer aware of what she was experienced. Patient stated her foot swelling went away. Patient stated her foot swelling went away. Patient stated she will be getting her leg Xrayed. Patient stated that a fork can stay attached to her arm, and she is not sure that is from her electricity or the vaccine. Patient declined to complete a safety report at the time of report. Reference number provided. Patient declined website information. The Patient was provided with phone number of, option 3, and hours of operation. The Patient also provided with phone number and hours of operation, if she would like to call back at another time. On an unspecified date of 2021, the patient underwent lab test: blood work: normal. The outcome of the event her foot swelled was recovered on unspecified date and unknown for other events. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested. further information has been requested

A 68 -year-old elderly female patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number: EL0142), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 29Dec2020 at 02:30 PM, (at the age of 68 -years-old) as a single dose, dose number=1 for COVID-19 vaccination. Medical history included hypothyroidism and osteopenia. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient's concomitant medications included levothyroxin and citalopram within 2 weeks of the vaccination. The patient did not receive any other vaccine within 4 weeks prior to the vaccine. On 02Jan2021, the patient woke up with a red and swollen, slightly itchy, left 4th finger, redness progressed to left hand, and arm, generalized red rash noted in groin and abdomen, slight headache and nausea. The patient was treated for red and swollen, slightly itchy, left 4th finger, redness progressed to left hand, and arm, generalized red rash noted in groin and abdomen, slight headache and nausea with diphenhydramine (BENADRYL) 50 mg x 1. The clinical outcome of red and swollen, slightly itchy, left 4th finger, redness progressed to left hand, and arm, generalized red rash noted in groin and abdomen, slight headache and nausea was recovering. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

The patient was supposed to have another dose on 12Feb2021 and wanted to know if she should. The patient currently still had partial hearing loss and was prescribed a Prednisone that she took for 5 days. Her arm did not hurt Friday through Sunday, however, on Monday, her arm was red, swollen, and growing. She was able to get partial hearing back after taking Prednisone. She had numbness in parts of the ear and was now able to feel parts of the ear, but she was not sure if the numbness will go away. The outcome of hearing loss was resolving, of other events was unknown.

skin was lighter in color; it was really rough; lose; itches; Rash; pain; swollen lymph nodes; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer and contactable other health professional. A 68-year-old female patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EJ1686), via an unspecified route of administration at arm left on 11Jan2021 at 11:30 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history included rheumatoid arthritis, coronary artery disease, both from an unknown date and unknown and COVID-19 from Mar2020 to an unknown date. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took flu vaccine and pneumococcal vaccine and for both experienced sickness, chills and "couldn't eat". The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EJ1685), via an unspecified route of administration on 22Dec2020 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization and experienced swollen lymph nodes. The patient experienced swollen lymph nodes on 12Jan2021, the rash was first noticed on 13Jan2021 and started on the right under arm (the opposite side she got the shot), there was pain. On 15Jan2021 it moved to the left side. The right side was starting to get better though her skin was lighter in color. The left side was about the same, it was really rough, lose and itches. It looks like elephant skin. Therapeutic measures were taken as result of events and included topic treatment with MINERIN CREAM (therapeutic moisturizer). The patient outcome of swollen lymph nodes was recovered (within 2 days), the outcome of rash and related events was not recovered.

swollen lymph nodes; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 68-years-old female patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine, Batch/lot number: EJ1685, via an unspecified route of administration on 22Dec2020 at 11:30, at 68 years of age, at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included rheumatoid arthritis diagnosed 3 years before this report, coronary artery disease she has had for about 10 years and takes losartan for it, COVID-19 infection from Mar2020 to an unknown date; her family history is relevant for diabetes mellitus. In 2019 the patient got 2 flu vaccines at the same time, the regular flu and the one for seniors, and also the pneumonia shot. So she got 3 vaccines at once. Afterward she got sick and was in bed with chills and everything, she couldn't eat and was sick for the day. It was explained that she was at work but left for the day. This only lasted for the one day and she was fine and back to work the next day. There were no concomitant medications. On 23Dec2020 the patient experienced swollen lymph nodes on her left side; she got the shot on that side due to bad arthritis on the right side. It wasn't that bad and disappeared after 2 days. She did tell the doctor and was told by the doctor it was thought to just be inflammation from the shot. The patient recovered from the reported event on an 25Dec2020.
68 2021-02-11 lymph node pain On the night of the vaccine my left arm was just slightly sore and I had a headache. I took 2 advil... Read more
Close
On the night of the vaccine my left arm was just slightly sore and I had a headache. I took 2 advil before bed and woke up the next morning fine. The real reaction came almost a week to the day later on Monday, Feb. 8 in them morning I noticed that my shoulder joint on my left arm was very sore and all of the lymph nodes from my shoulder to my elbow on just my left arm were very achey. This came and went off and on all that day. I did not take anything for it because I wanted to see how long it lasted. By the next morning it was entirely gone and has remained gone and I feel just fine.
68 2021-02-15 c-reactive protein increased 68-year-old female evaluated for painful movement of her extremities. Patient reports that her sympt... Read more
Close
68-year-old female evaluated for painful movement of her extremities. Patient reports that her symptoms started the day after receiving the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at pharmacy. Patient was admitted. Patient has been evaluated by Neurology, Rheumatology and the Ortho-Spine Service. Symptoms improved with prednisone. Although unclear, a diagnosis of polymyalgia rheumatica was being considered due to elevated CRP (inflammatory marker). Relationship to vaccine administration is also unclear. Pt with Hx of arthritis, COPD, CAD, CHF, and HTN received first dose of Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine. Within 24 hours of vaccine administration, pt went to hospital c/o of painful movement of extremities. Pt was treated with prednisone and symptoms improved. She was evaluated by multiple specialties including neurology, rheumatology and orthopedics without a clear diagnosis. Her CRP was elevated to 17.2 mg/dL and Sed Rate to greater than 130 mm/hr and reactive ANA titer. Total CK was normal at 23 IU/L. Rheumatology wrote this is highly suggestive of COVID-19 vaccine induced polymyalgia rheumatica which has been reported with other vaccines but not with COVID-19 vaccines.

out like a 'light' and this stuff knock her out; whole entire face her head, down her back her neck was numb/Numbness in leg/jaws are numb; I'm feeling my teeth are still and my jaws are numb; felt very odd sensation as she was swallowing; was closing up but much wasn't closing up/it was not full open; swelling on her throat; Muscle pain in my left arm where they gave me injection and it hurts my neck area across my back down my arms specially my left side; it hurts my neck area across my back; it hurts my neck area across my back; Stumbling; face was swollen; eyes looks like little switch; thirsty; felt very sluggish; nose started to running; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 68-year-old female patient received first single dose BNT162B2 (Solution for injection, batch/lot number and exp date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration (anatomical location: arm left) on 29Jan2021 15:00 for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included insomnia and asthma. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Patient stated, "I got the vaccine yesterday about 3 pm and I came home and I had dinner and sat down to watch TV at 9 O' clock, I turn the program on and I was out like a 'light' and this stuff knock me out (onset date: 29Jan2021). My dog has to wake me up licking my face at 3:15 this morning. I normally don't sleep long 4 hours and that's it. I'm 68 years old and I have insomnia (History) but when I woke up I was stumbling around, still have to sleep (onset date Jan2021), I took the dog out to walk and came back and saw myself in mirror, my face was swollen and my eyes looks like little switch. I noticed, I was thirsty and I went to get and drank, some coke because I felt very sluggish and I drank some coke and when I was swallowing the coke I felt very odd sensation as I was swallowing, I noticed that after swallowing. I have asthma (History) to begin with so I'm anticipated on having some of the symptoms it start showing up a bit, my nose started to running and I noticed that my whole entire face my head, down my back my neck was numb along with swelling on my throat, I felt okay but I felt it wasn't being, it was closing up but much wasn't closing up you know what I mean it was not full open. I also had muscle pain in my left arm where they gave me injection and it hurts my neck area across my back down my arms specially my left side. I also noticed I went to a lovely person and when I went to bathroom I pull my pants down I felt numbness on my legs. So, my whole body was kind of having that not tingling sensation but numb and when I ran my fingers across my leg you know how you feel numbness when you run your fingers across a part of your body when it's numb that's exactly how I felt and that was about 3:30 this morning that happened I woke up by but I also want to ask question because I got to go back to my second shot. I'm wondering if I go back to my second dose am I going to have even more intense reaction to the stuff that I get this time." Patient further added "I was still trying to eat something but I'm feeling my teeth are still and my jaws are numb and this I got since yesterday (29Jan2021)." The outcome of events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
Starting the first day I had muscle aches, swollen glands, headache, tiredness and chills, this lasted for three days. Then I did feel better for a few days but had some tiredness. Then Sunday the 28th my body seemed over whelmed with sweats and chills, I developed a rash in my groin area and realized that I had a yeast infection that was affecting my vaginal area, groin, and mouth. I have been treating this with a natural yeast complex and Monistat. I am starting to do better today but felt that I needed to report it to see if others were having the same problem. I feel that the injection adversely affected my body's normal hemostasis and the yeast was the results. I am not looking forward to getting the next shot. I think I did have Covid 19 in late January or early February before it was widely known and there were no tests. I will keep treating myself with natural remedies as chemicals will just inflame the yeast at this time. This is not life threatening but wanted to report the abnormal reaction I have experienced.

68 2021-03-03 swollen extremities, peripheral swelling I received the vaccine at 9AM on March 1st in my right arm. Everything was fine until 3 PM when my ... Read more
Close
I received the vaccine at 9AM on March 1st in my right arm. Everything was fine until 3 PM when my right arm started swelling. I ran a temperature of 100.1, had fatigue and a headache, in addition to aches and pains. By Tuesday morning my right arm from the injection site to the elbow was twice it's normal size. My chest and underarm area were both significantly swollen. I had an 8:30 AM appointment on Tuesday with an allergist who advised me to take Benadryl, which I did. By Wednesday, my chest and abdominal area were both swollen. I had a lymphedema therapy appointment because I have lymphedema on my left side due to node removal. The therapist measured both arms and they were both swollen, including my chest and abdomen. The therapist advised me to see my oncologist as swelling in the Right Arm, (where i received the shot) was normal for COVID shots, but she could not explain the swelling in the chest or abdomen. Other than that my lymphatic system was working overtime. I called my oncologist on Thursday March 4, and they fit me in. Doctor examined me and he couldn't explain to me why I was swelling up the way I was. He has only seen arm swelling in his breast cancer patients. He is referring me to get a PET scan and advised me to see a breast surgeon as maybe the surgeon would know more about the lymph nodes.

Close
Clinic course: 13:50 patient given covid vaccine #2-Pfizer. 14:10 patient c/o sob and throat closing. 02 sat 94%. Epipen 0.15 mg given IM to lt thigh. 02 at 4l/nc started. 14;15 EMS called to transport patient to UTMB ER. Bp-150/88, p-75. O2 sAT 98% ON O2@4L/NC. Patient Has audible wheezing and unable to talk above slight whisper. 14:20 Patient feeling a little better. Talking in a louder whisper now. Denies sob. States throat still feels like throat is opening a little. 02Sat 98% on 02 at 4l/nc. Patient was evaluated by NP- Employee Health. 14: 25- patient feeling better. I asked her if she has ever had a reaction needing epi pen before and she stated yes. For allergy shot. I asked her if she told MA when asked and she stated no as I didn't think I would be able to get covid vaccine if I said anything about it. She states no reaction to 1st covid vaccine. ED Course: is a 68 year old female with CAD s/p PCI, HLD, OSA, seizures, HTN, asthma who presents after anaphylaxis following 2nd dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Chest tightness and original EKG concerning for STEMI, but on review EKG was artifact and did not evolve. Normal sinus the following day with resolution of symptoms. Epipen also improved symptoms which would be inconsistent with ischemia. Patient respiratory status improved on prednisone and breathing treatments. Patient is now stable for discharge.
68 2021-03-04 guillain-barre syndrome Guillain-Barre syndrome; achy arm; tingling sensation from head to toe/whole body was tingling/weird... Read more
Close
Guillain-Barre syndrome; achy arm; tingling sensation from head to toe/whole body was tingling/weird and scary on and off sensation; This is a spontaneous report from two contactable consumers (patient's cousin and patient herself). A 68-year-old female patient received her second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EN6201), via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 10Feb2021 10:30 AM at a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included anxiety. It was reported that the patient was "physically fit. She was thin and was about 5 feet." Ongoing concomitant medications included escitalopram (reported as "generic Lexapro") for anxiety, calcium, and multivitamins. The patient previously received flu vaccine in Oct2020. She also had her first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL9262) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 20Jan2021 10:30 AM for COVID-19 immunization and felt a little soreness in arm and light headache the same day. Two nights later, her scalp felt on fire and had tingling sensation in her face for three weeks. A week after the first dose, her blood pressure went up to 210/101. She went to the hospital, they controlled her pressure and put her on a pressure pill 1 a day (amlodipine). She mentioned she had felt a weird sensation and noticed some spikes in her blood pressure. Her physician told her to take another 2.5 mg amlodipine if needed. After her second dose, she went to sleep with achy arm. she woke up that night with a tingling sensation from head to toe. Her whole body was tingling. It was a weird and scary on and off sensation. She stated it had improved during the past two days. The patient confirmed that she had no heart rate problems. She actually experienced high blood pressure instead. She never had numbness, instead she had a tingling sensation still present. She mentioned her 97-year-old mother and husband both got the two doses with no complication or reactions. The patient's cousin was "pretty sure that it's Guillain-Barre." The patient stated the Guillain-Barre syndrome has not yet been confirmed. She had an appointment with a neurologist. The outcome of 'tingling sensation from head to toe/whole body was tingling/weird and scary on and off sensation' was recovering, of remaining events was unknown.

68 2021-03-16 anaphylactic reaction she was so tired; Rash on both arms and inside arms/Rash on Face/rash on front and back of knees; bu... Read more
Close
she was so tired; Rash on both arms and inside arms/Rash on Face/rash on front and back of knees; burning and itching with bleeding; swelling in lips; Blood in stool/she had blood in her stool, leaking blood around rectum and it had like a burning itch; Blood leaking around rectum/she had blood in her stool, leaking blood around rectum and it had like a burning itch; Face and Neck Burning/hot face and neck was flushed; hot face and neck was flushed; Tingling in tongue, lips, face; Tingling in tongue, lips, face; throat felt tight; lips were puffy; thought she was starting to shake; anaphylactic event; severe allergic reaction; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via Medical Information Team. A 68-year-old female patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE, lot number: EN6199), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm (left shoulder area) on 06Mar2021 17:45 at SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had no additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer vaccine. The patient had no prior vaccination within 4 weeks. Medical history included upset stomach after eating banana's last year (2020). There were no concomitant medications. The patient had no family medical history relevant to events. The patient previously took bactrim and pneumonia vaccine and experienced anaphylactic reaction to both. On 06Mar2021, the patient experienced anaphylactic event, allergic reaction, face and neck burning, hot face and neck was flushed, tingling in tongue, lips, face, swelling lips, throat felt tight, and lips were puffy. On 07Mar2021, the patient experienced rash, blood in stool, blood leaking around rectum, burning and itching with bleeding. The patient further reported that she had a 'serious life threatening event' after first dose of the Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine on 06Mar2021. Hospital papers say 'anaphylactic event.' Tingling in lips tongue and face, hot face and neck after vaccine, swelling in lips, rash started yesterday evening (07Mar2021), bloody stools for a few hours yesterday evening (07Mar2021) but has resolved. The patient was seen in emergency room (ER) via ambulance. The patient asked if there was a chance the preservative in the vaccine caused her reaction and if the potassium in the vaccine causing her anaphylactic reaction. Additionally, the patient reported that she had a severe allergic reaction this past Saturday to the Covid Vaccine, stated the nurse sent her back to the pharmacist who told her she was having an allergic reaction to the vaccine. The patient reported having a hot face and neck was flushed, after the vaccine, she stated she had tingling in her tongue, lips, and face. And she stated her throat felt tight also, her lips were puffy, and a lot of heat of neck and face, thought she was starting to shake. The patient reported the pharmacist gave EpiPen in thigh and 20 mg tablet of Benadryl and called 911, and took her to the local hospital. Patient also reported that she has not seen this doctor yet she asked to see her and has an appointment with her. The patient also stated that her new PCP was not aware of the reaction to the vaccine at this time. The patient further mentioned that she was still having a rash that broke out. She reported that her tongue was tingling and she still has some swelling in her lips. Patient continues to clarify she still has swelling and some tingling on the tip of tongue and half back on her tongue. She stated that the swelling was persisting and that Benadryl or Prednisone does give some relief but it comes back. Patient mentioned being on a 4 day cycle of Prednisone, takes two in the morning with food. The patient clarified the location of the rash as a rash on both arms that was inside of both of the arms, like a pink rash, she states it was on face and on knees around the front and back of her knees like a red rash. She continues it was on the neck down to the collar bone around the back of her neck, like if she was a bust statue it would be all in that area from the collar bones at that point up and around the back of the shoulder blades. It goes all the way around face and neck. Patient also further reported that she had a scary reaction last night (07Mar2021), she said she had blood in her stool, leaking blood around rectum and it had like a burning itch, when she wiped it was blood, she continued to say when she wiped it was like 'giblets.' She stated was stool, blood, and giblets. Patient stated this lasted for about and hour and half or 2 hours until the stool stopped and it was about 1:30 am before she finally went to sleep, she was so tired on an unspecified date. She stated she took Benadryl right away. She continued to report the bleeding has resolved completely as of this point and reported a regular bowel movement today (08Mar2021). She has two Epi Pens from the drug store that was prescribed but she was afraid to use it, and she thought to see what happens if she uses the Benadryl. She received the Epi shot at the drug store, at (pharmacy), when her reaction broke out, on 06Mar2021, in her thigh, for the allergic reaction. This was her first time ever receiving EpiPen (Lot 029F20AA, expiration Mar2022, and NDC is 0093-5986-27). The ER doctor prescribed her 0.3 mg every 5-15 minutes as needed for anaphylaxis, and not to exceed 3 doses. She received the Benadryl at the drug store, 120mg tablet, first dose was given at drug store. Patient reported she was given prednisone IV in hand through IV at ER, she doesn't know how much that was, then was given Prednisone to go home with- 20mg tablets take 2 a day for 4 days, which she started Sunday morning, 07Mar2021. She was told she experienced a life threatening allergic reaction. Patient was taken to the ER in the ambulance, the paramedic who was with her said she was his first COVID reaction patient. ER doctor told her not to take the second dose of Pfizer vaccine, and to be cautious if taking the EpiPen, she states her heart was racing because of the EpiPen and was told it was because she was not younger that her body did not handle the Epi like younger people do and was told she could have a heart attack from the EpiPen. She was scared because she was not covered fully, since she can't get the second shot of Pfizer, and she was afraid of the Epi Pen, so she was really in a tough spot. ER doctor stated she may be able to take the Johnson and Johnson vaccine, as the second, but she needs to talk to her Primary care about that. The ER doctor continued to tell her it would have to be a special case where she was in a hospital setting in case she has another serious reaction, she was concerned for not receiving the second dose because that means she was not completely covered with one vaccine. She was afraid of the Epi-Pen since she can get a heart attack from it because of her age. The patient mentioned she was tested in Oct (clarified as 14Oct2020) for Covid due to having a viral infection at that time but was negative. Added the ER paper work says ED anaphylaxis. The patient wanted to ask about finding out the ingredients in Pfizer vaccine and the ingredients in the Johnson and Johnson vaccine. She saw the list on the fact sheet of Pfizer's ingredients and in a few places it says Potassium, 3 different ingredients, and several months ago, she quit eating bananas, bananas have potassium, and they were giving her stomach upset, diarrhea, she used to eat them all her life, she noticed that there was a lot of potassium in the medicine. Doctor wanted to know if she would be able to take the Johnson and Johnson vaccine. He said if she got the second shot, of the Johnson and Johnson, that it would have to be a special case, like in a hospital setting, and there would have to be medical people in a medical center, to take care of her was she has a reaction to it as well. He advised that she take the Johnson and Johnson than not taking it, because by not taking it, she was very vulnerable to catching COVID 19. And patient wanted to know was it a preservative that was causing the reaction. It was reported that rash began around 10PM, bloody stool began between 11 PM and 12:30 AM, all other symptoms within 15-20 minutes, it began around 6PM, maybe sooner 5:55 PM, she was in denial, it felt like tongue and lips tingling, she did have a reaction before to a different shot. The anaphylactic reaction required emergency room visit. Patient was not hospitalized and was in observation in ER. On 08Mar2021, the patient recovered from blood in stool, rectal bleeding, and burning and itching with bleeding. The patient had not yet recovered from severe allergic reaction, hot face and neck was flushed, tingling in tongue, lips, face; lips were puffy, and rash. The outcome of throat felt tight, thought she was starting to shake, she was so tired, and swelling in lips was unknown.

A 68-year-old female patient received her first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), from lot# EL9261, via unknown route on 12Feb2021 12:00 (at the age of 68-years-old) at left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had not medical history. Concomitant medications were not reported. Vaccination Facility Type: Hospital. On 12Feb2021 the patient experienced left arm pain, pain chest, can't hardly use her left arm, it is so sore and on 14Feb2021 Pain radiating from chest to left side of neck and Swollen Lymph Nodes. Caller stated that she was thinking needs to go to the Emergency Room because it could be her lymph nodes, a blood clot, or her heart. She stated that she has been experiencing this since day one and nobody else has had side effects but her. She stated that this was out of the ordinary and according to the list she was given, it was not listed as a side effect. She was supposed to go tomorrow to get second shot, but she didn't think that she was going to be able to do it. No emergency room or physician office required. The outcome of the events at the time of last observation was reported as not recovered. Treatment was none. The events were assessed as serious, important medical events.; Sender's Comments: Based on available information, a possible contributory role of the subject product, BNT162B2 vaccine, cannot be excluded for the reported events due to temporal relationship Additional information is needed to better assess the case, including complete medical history, diagnostics, counteractive treatment measures and concomitant medications. There is limited information provided in this report. This case will be reassessed upon receipt of follow-up information. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
